I was disappointed I was not asked what type of noodle I wanted since they had a few to choose from I was not given the choice, I would have preferred the thicker noodle than what I got.  Also, putting some of the hot sauce from the table in the soup spiced it up quite a bit which made it that much better.  In the end it's no Noodle Asia but for a cheap bowl of Noodle Soup I would go back.  I would have given it 3.5 stars but they don't do halves so I rounded down since I didn't get to pick my noodle.
Very good. Cheap. Will definitely go back.

It's a treat to take my son here to practice his mandarin and order items in the language.  What's more noteworthy is the consistency of the meals.  They make the noodles onsite through a window where you or the young ones can watch and there are choices.  What I enjoy is that there is around 40 choices limited to a few types of dishes and your. It overwhelmed with 1000 items that are impossible to quality check.    Today we ordered the steamed dumplings (a favorite), slices beef stew (see pic) with amazingly tender and quality beef and noodle and egg roles which are delish.  I rated a four because there is always an awkward aroma when you arrive which makes the event somewhat difficult at first.  The other reason is that I find the noodles to be a little bland but that may just be preference not quality.  Note: No adult beverages served and very family friendly.

What's magical about this place? It's the actual making of the noodles and its authenticity! Oodles of noodles!  The skilled chef and the art of noodle making can be seen in the back of the restaurant as you are eating. My fave dish is #22 minced pork noodles with julienned cucumber slices, on a bed of lettuce and sprinkled with scallions. You're able to select the type of noodle but I always go with the hand pulled noodles. It's a great take-out item. I've also tried the beef noodle stew with the hand pulled noodles. If you're dining in you will most likely be served with a plate of steamed peanuts lightly salted and de-shelled. Try picking it up with your chopsticks for those of you that are chopstick challenged. ;)  This place is awesome because it's considered a cheap eat! Who doesn't love that?
Love this place, we have been here many times and the owner is very nice and they have the best hand made noodles in the valley.

This was our first time visiting this restaurant after reading numerous great reviews of the place.  Overall first impressions of the restaurant were mediocre at best, as the decor isn't anything special.  We were greeted promptly after walking through the door and were seated right away.  Based on previous reviews, we ordered the pot stickers as an appetizer.  The reviews definitely didn't disappoint, as these were BY FAR the best I've ever eaten!  They were fried perfectly, large in size and the dipping sauce they came with was delicious.  My husband ordered the beef w/stir-fried noodles and I had the chicken w/stir-fried noodles w/the spicy sauce.  We both ordered different noodles with our dishes and both were delicious (wide and flat & thin noodles).  Overall, we were VERY happy with the quality of the food and the portion size - very generous and we took home lots of leftovers.  When we visit again, I'm going to order just the pot stickers, as they are a meal in itself.  As for the service, the restaurant wasn't busy, yet we didn't have anyone checking on us and we had to wait for our check to be delivered (servers were sitting in chairs on their cell phone).  Luckily, the food made-up for the  poor service and will not prevent us from coming back again.

Very disappointed as there are some great reviews for this place. We were not  impressed. I ordered the noodle soup with beef. The noodles were fairly doughy, beef was not very lean with large areas of gristle and fat and the broth was fairly bland as was the overall flavor in general. We also ordered noodles with seafood. The white sauce was akin to "Campbell's Cream of" soup. Our waiter was unfriendly and borderline rude.     Atmosphere was cold and unwelcoming, will definitely not be returning.
The noodles here are tender, yet chewy and firm. The asian dude that makes your noodles is good.

My hungry family of 5 tried this place out because of the location and high ratings. I got a little nervous when we pulled up because the front isn't all that inviting (in a strip mall with a vacant tenant next door). We pressed on.  I'm really glad we did! Our 3 kids shared the chicken noodles (we chose the flat thick noodles, which was a great choice), and my husband and I shared the beef noodles... which was way better than the chicken. Both were good though. We also got the famous dumplings which were really delicious and huge.  Our food came super quick, which is awesome when you have little ones. We got the boba teas for desert and we were full and happy. We still had left overs, even with the two dishes and 1 app. Oh, and the bill was awesome, around $25. Can't beat quality food for that price. We had good quick service too. Totally happy, we'll be back :)
I had the beef with fried noodles and it was good for my first time here You get to pick from several types of noodles. Will definitely come back to try other dishes.

I truly wish I could give it a better review. My sister loves this place and the reviews make it sound amazing! The only thing I liked were the noodles! I must say those were amazing!!! Best I've ever had. There was 1 person when we walked in at noon. They sat us at a booth that had holes ripped all in it. I guess for a hole in the wall kind of place it makes sense but still. It quickly got packed though within 20mins! They brought us cold noodles and peanuts to munch on till we got our meal. It was decent. My kids ( 7 & 5 yr old) shared the teriyaki chicken appetizer w/white rice. It was good but basically tasted like fried chicken without the breading. Again, good just not what I expected because there was little to no teriyaki flavoring. I had the shrimp & noodles. Shrimp was very rubbery which is a let down. Not much spice (which it did not say it would have any) so next time I will ask if we return. So 50% of the dish wasn't good. Saving grace was the noodles of course. My fiancé did have the spicy beef & noodles. Wasn't spicy AT ALL!!!! So that was a huge let down. I excepted that to be spicy. We love super burn your mouth spicy and this was basically good seasoning....that's it. So overall my whole experience became a let down. I hate to do this to small business owners but I think it it's important to know true experiences so you can decide if you want to do anything about it.

My husband and I ate here last night. Complimentary boiled peanuts and pickled veg along with water were brought to the table immediately. Water was good. The peanuts and veg were meh.    We ordered the egg roll appetizer.  They served it piping hot with to go packets of "duck sauce" and "hot mustard". I expect more from a place with hand pulled noodles. They should really take the time to make their own sauces. Which more or less was a foreshadowing of things to come. The rolls themselves were good but greasy.  Our drinks were brought out quickly. Boba Milk Tea for me, iced tea for my husband. (Which I later had to ask to be refilled. Yes, one more please).  Our entrees soon followed. Both dishes were cheap, hot, and heaping. As with many Asian places, they provide condiments for you to customize your food. This tray had hot chili oil, vinegar, soy, and sriracha sauce.  The food itself was rather bland though.  It needed doctoring.  I wish they had added more flavor at the beginning during cooking.  We ended up taking about half of our food home. I reheated in a pan with some stir fry sauce and a little fish sauce. Much better.  We probably won't be back. I'd rather spend my money on a lot more flavor.
Fun place with the family. Literally "hand made" noodles.  Plus the serving size was gigantic!
Great place for noodles! They have really good price also with sufficient amount of noodles. Definitely get full by one bowl. The people there are also really nice at services.

Definitely my favorite noodle shop in Arizona!  They have a big window so you can watching them stretching the noodles out.  My favorite dish is the beef noodle oyster sauce.  Also swai fish filet is really good.

Noodles hand rolled right infront of you.... doesnt get much better than that. Love it! Once you see the 5 different types of noodles that you can chhose from, you'll just be confused. But confused in a good way :-)

Probably one of the most authentic Chinese restaurants in the Phoenix area. I come from LA so I've definitely had better but after living out in Arizona for the past 5 weeks, I've been craving some authentic Chinese food.   The noodles are fresh and chewy. Soup base for the beef noodle can use improvements though. More pickled vegetables, please. And the vegetarian sesame noodles had nothing but sesame paste and noodles so it was a bit disappointing. Usually, I'ld expect cucumbers and carrots or something. The stewed beef cold dish was alright also. The drinks on the other hand are very good and sweet, just my liking. However, I wished they used real fruits for the smoothies rather than just flavored high fructose corn syrup. (total 3 stars)  So, for the pat on the back for opening one of the first authentic noodle house in Phoenix (+1 star).

Interior is meh. Booths are torn. Watching the guy make your noodles is cool.   The soups are terrible. Tried the beef stew and the sliced beef soup with the wide and regular noodles respectively. The broth was the same for both and tasted old and off. Noodles were good though. Beef stew beef was tough and chewy. However, there was bone in the soup.  Customer service is atrocious. The beef stew had broken chips in it from the beef having sat in the soup for so long. It was soft but it was still bone chips. Wtf. Complained to the manager said they don't do refunds. 1 star take your business elsewhere.
Loved their noodles! The food is good and portions are huge, but service was really slow. Maybe because I was there at lunchtime. I spent almost 30 minutes waiting for my order.
Great place loved their noodles. She brought me more lamb in a side dish because my soup didn't have much lamb. Very nice people.

I had the seafood noodle soup with hand shaved noodles and it was delicious.  It came to the table really hot.  It was full of shrimp, fish balls, scallops and squid along with the shaved noodles.  It was a good broth that over time acquired flavor from all the ingredients and was very tasty.

The noodles here are so good and taste so fresh!! I got the veggie stir fry and was a little disappointed to only find cabbage, carrots and bean sprouts. I would like to see more veggies and less oil in the future but I still definitely recommend this place!

China Magic Noodle House is one of my favorite names of any restaurant ever. Tucked away in a corner of the plaza, the worst part of the China Magic Noodle House experience is decidedly the parking. Even so, you can usually find a spot pretty close to the entrance because it's fairly far from the Lee Lee's.   The first thing you should do for yourself after you sit down is order the dumplings. For real. They are gargantuan and hearty and wonderful. I prefer them pan-fried, but the steamed are also great. They are probably my favorite dumplings in the entire world. Strong words, I know. Another appetizer I'd recommend is the assorted marinated meat platter. I couldn't for the life of me identify which meats they are, but are served cold and are excellent, and come with pickled vegetables that pair perfectly.   Also highly recommended are any of the stir fry noodles. My personal favorite are the beef with XO sauce, because they are just the perfect amount of spicy, in my opinion. We also had the noodles with spicy sauce (a separate menu item) and would probably pass on those next time. They're good, but just don't hold a candle to the stir fried.   This place is great for a casual meal, and super affordable. Things come out quickly, so you can get in and out in a reasonable amount of time. If you're looking for an affordable, authentic Chinese meal (that consists almost entirely of various shades of brown foods), then look no further.

So so so good!  What a delightful surprise. We stopped en route to CA, mainly because of the homemade noodles. But this place surpassed our expectation. Very good noodles, sauces, cooked to perfection. With great service to go along with it. Thank you for making my family happy eaters tonight!

For those who hate kim chee, stay away, because the smell of it will hit you in the face like the horrible phoenix heat.  As soon as I get seated, they serve complimentry steamed peanuts and what looks like julienne carrots and white radish... yum!  I ordered the Beef Stew w/Noodles, and I swear, it look them literally 6 minutes to bring it out. Now that was quick!! I immediately scarf down the tasty broth with thin noodles, green onions, baby spinach, and what looked like chinese radishes. Very authentic. If you crave P.F. Chang's and Panda Express, you will probably not like this place.   It's cool since you can see the Noodle chefs going at it through the window of the kitchen, twisting and slapping those noodles!!  Service is not super friendly, but enough to get by. I wish I could only doc 1/2 a star since this place is ssoooo good. Eating here made me nostalgic just thinking of where I'm from (San Jose, CA).  I have now found an authentic Noodle House - - Not from the Bay Area, CA?! I am truly shocked.  $6.50 for my experience? Magical.

Found this place on Yelp so decided to give it a try.  You can easily see the noodles being made through the window from the dining room, looks like fun :)  Had read about the pot stickers (aka dumplings) so ordered those and I have never seen dumplings this big before, full of delicious meat filling. Also got the green beans which were crisp and fresh cooked with garlic.  The Hong Kong buns are like having a little dessert before the meal, lightly fried pillows of dough dipped in a sweet sauce, so good.  For the main dish and trust me after all the other stuff hardly had room, but ordered the stir fried chicken and wide noodles.  Very tasty big portion.  Have enough leftovers for another full meal for 2!!!!

This place is really cool and has some of the freshest Noodles in town. Just happened to be in the neighborhood and had to check them out. After all they have a dude in the back tossing noodle up and down and slamming them on a large table. You can see him through the kitchen window.  The menu here has a large assortment of different types of both noodle sizes and shapes. You can basically pick the type of noodle you want and they will make one of their tasty dishes to your specifications.  Inside is very nice with all the condiments you need right at your table. Some of the tables are bigger and can suport those crazy noodle parties that can spontaneously erupt.  Started with the Pan Fried Dumplings with dipping sauce. The plate was gigantic and could be a meal just by itself. Ordered the Seafood Noodle Soup with one of the larger flat noodles. Both dishes were delightful and I really enjoyed getting to doctor them up with their homemade hot sauce.  So many different things on the menu with several choices of flavors and textures. This place is really fun and a delicious treat. Can't wait to come back and try some of their other items. Hear that the Spicy Pig Ear is also very good. No Pun intended.  Located in the same parking lot as Lee Lee's. See ya there next time. MAGIC TAKES THE SHOT ... SCORES!  4.5 STARS
Had the cold pig ears, pork noodle dish, and pan fried dumplings.  Meh, it was okay but not worth going back.

Well what can I say, this place is too legit to quit.  My wife, child, & I went to eat here on a whim and ordered about 5 things on the menu and each was equally good.  I can't say enough about this place, I am a Chinese food pro and this place is worth trying before any other.  Every one enjoyed the food, definitely a city treasure.

Chinese is usually not my cuisine of choice but I LOVE China Magic Noodle.   You get to peek in the kitchen and see the noodles made fresh. Everything here is quality from their ingredients to their to-go containers lol. Fast and friendly service. Everyone who've I've recommended to come here has also become regular customers.   My favorite dish is the seafood stir fry with shaven noodles (E) and the pan fried dumplings are a must!
Fantastic Gyoza, pot stickers, mein and noodle soup.  Nothing else comes close.

All of the noodles are hand pulled so this is definitely a must visit! I was recommended to it by an elderly Chinese gentleman and I was not disappointed. You can choose what size and type of noodle you'll like and you can even watch them make it. The noodles can come with vegetables, meat, and either on a plate or as a soup.  We ordered The Beef Rib Noodle Bowl and The Beef Noodle with Oyster Sauce plate. Both were very delicious! I did however find the plate more flavorful than the bowl, so I recommend that one more.  The service was exceptional! A young woman helped us who had an incredible amount of patience and was very sweet. Also, our order did not take very long at all.  Also, the bathroom is gorgeous. It's gold leafed so definitely take a look at that.  I actually look forward to coming back very soon. I'm so happy that we have an authentic Chinese noodle house in the valley.

The food is good, and the best part is the ability to see the noodles they make but at the end of the day their food tastes similar to other restaurants in the same category.  The atmosphere is boring and it is plain. Not an intimate restaurant, not fancy and typical casual dining.
Pretty good variety.  Been here a few times.  Hit or miss. Sometimes really flavorful,  sometimes bland. I think I just don't know what to order.  Small place.  Staff is pleasant

I was actually against going to this place, but my boyfriend insisted and was drawn in to these hand-pulled noodles. So off we went...  Plenty of parking in front of this corner resto in the plaza. Open til 10pm I believe on Saturday. Typical Asian joint. We got the assorted marinated meat combo appetizer (which tasted awesome IN my soup). I went for the oxtail soup while the boyfriend had beef noodles in oyster sauce. Both of course with the hand pulled noodles.  We both slurped up all of our noodles. Happy tummies! And very friendly on the wallet. Great find on our short visit to Arizona.

I love funky food and the marinated pig ear is really nice. Love that you can watch them hand pull their noodles fresh to order. Being right next to Lee Lee Market you can have a bite to eat and get inspired to go next door and look for the off the wall ingredients to go and make your own at home. Only thing I don't like is it is a 45 minute drive from my house.

Took off a star and a half because the novelty of the hand pulled noodle show has worn off and to be honest I don't think the hand pulled noodles taste any better than store bought dried noodles, or dare I say it, not even as good, and aside from the fresh noodle show I don't think the dishes here are that good.  I'll just be going back to all my favorites a few miles further north on Dobson, or just around the corner at Peking Palace - oops I mean Phoenix Palace - Peking Palace is my favorite in Tucson.  2 1/2 stars rounded up to 3.
Beef noodles with oyster sauce. Thats dat shit I do like! Nothing fancy here. If you're lookin to grub, this is just the place! The steamed dumplings are huge and delicious. Get them!

Pretty tasty food but. I was sick so I don't know if it was that or if the soup was loaded with MSG, but my mouth was pretty dry and scratchy afterward. There was also .5 in of a sharp wooden skewer in my soup. They said it was to add flavor to the broth?? Pretty sure it was just a skewer that wasn't caught. I denied the discount and just told them to be more careful. Maybe I'd come back for the dry noodle dishes.
Fast service,amazing pot stickers,good prices. Tons of food that is freshly made. Will go again

love this place! i really like their soups and how you can see the guy in the kitchen window making fresh dough and stretching it to make noodles!everything is fresh and looks like a clean atmosphere.its a small hidden place in the leelee market plaza.its like a diamond in the rough.
Special today was salt and pepper shrimp.  Lightly dusted with corn starch and magic then deep fried and topped with jalapenos. all gone, tails and all =9
Best place for hand pulled noodle along with pan fried dumplings!  Not much to say about this place other than it is a crowded lot, but the food here was surprisingly good for being in Arizona.

Saw a noodle house advertised and wondered where it was.  Been eating at Phoenix Palace for several months before I discovered China Magic.  First time we were the only patrons in the restaurant; my friend from Long Island is very particular about her Chinese food; she loves this place.  My other friend is very picky about food to begin with; but still he loves this place.  So, we brought another friend from the Philippines and he really loves this place.  Just mostly stick to the noodle dishes.  Wish the drive wasn't so far; but definately be back.

I came here once a long time ago and found their food rather bland so I swore to myself I'd never return. This week, I mistakenly returned to this restaurant not knowing I had been in before until my order came and I remembered the taste of their broth. It is realllllllllly bland. But I notice their clientele is on the older side and maybe these older Asians prefer their soup on the more watery side (I've had asian soups that taste intentionally bland before) so I can't dock them completely because it didn't fit my taste. And their noodles are very good. They have a nice texture to them. But their lamb soup was just filled with bones and I felt rather shorted for my meal because I barely got any lamb meat to eat. And I had to work for my meat by sucking it off the bone, which was not easy! I did give them credit for hospitality tho because when I brought it to their attention, the server said he would bring me more meat. Sadly tho, the extra meat was just extra bones, so I was still extremely disappointed. I am now bookmarking this restaurant as a restaurant not to return to. But if you like bland soup with tasty noodles, I'd say come here and experience their noodles. I really want to give them 1-2 stars for food taste in my personal experience but feel that would not give them some credit for their hospitable service after serving me my gross (and dangerous!) food. So thru get a mediocre 3...

Love the hand made fresh noodles and their steam dumplings made by home made dough. Good price good value. However, recently I found the noodle quality is not very stable. One time, the very popular noodle C ox tail soup is cooked perfectly tender, another time the thickest kind of noodle ox tail soup was not completely cooked.  The dumpling meat favor is so strong that my hubby can't tell it's pork, which is a good thing to us, because he doesn't like pork, if he knows ahead, he probably won't even try. Anyway, the meat favor is so strong that even he knows it's pork later, he still didn't mind and ate them all :) like!

I was in town from L.A. visiting family and friends for the holidays and thought I'd try this place out. What a disappointment, the noodles were rubbery and the potstickers sucked. The only thing good was the broth. I'm pretty sure there are some good items to eat but my order was a disappointment. The service wasn't very good too.

Hands down some of the best noodles I have ever had I ordered number 34 and it was a Amazing it said spicy but it wasn't overwhelming it's a noodle stir fry with veggies and beef also that the dumplings omg perfect in size and more then enough per order will be returning very soon to get my noodle and dumpling fix

Best Noodles In Town!!!  I love China Magic Noodle so much that when people ask for a good Chinese restaurant I always tell them China Magic Noodle!  A few people that I have told about this restaurant have come back to me telling me how good it was.  The noodles are so delicious you will not be disappointed. I like that you can watch the chef make the noodles through the window. Because they're freshly made in house the noodles tend to be long, which I like.  The wait staff is very attentive too.   You won't be disappointed!
I love this place the noodles are hand made, great prices, large portions, super quick and friendly staff !
Fresh noodles . Soup broth was not that flavorful. But they were nice and fresh. . Service was a little slow. I need to try again. Noodles  were a little  over done. Prices were reasonable

Ordered the seafood soup with regular noodles for takeout. The soup and noodles were both amazing! The regular sized noodles were huge (but not too big), I can't imagine how big any of the larger noodles are! The seafood soup had lots of seafood and a good variety. I like that they served the soup separately of the noodles and that I could add the amount of noodles to the soup as I wished. The serving was large enough to have a whole bowl leftover for the lunch the next day. I dare say it was even better the day after!  We also had an order of egg rolls, and spring rolls. I though the egg rolls a little bland and dry but the spring rolls were phenomenal! Highly recommended. Looking forward to trying more dishes.

This place is amazing, the noodles are fresh and come with a texture thats unforgettable. There is a wide variety of noodles and rice dishes as well. I got the OX tail when i went and let me tell you it was delicious!

I personally love this place. They have the BEST noodles ever. The only down side, although not a problem for me, is the smell. The people I take here only talk about the smell and how it stinks. But trust me, GET OVER IT. The food is AMAZING!

Man I love this place. I am so happy it rained today because what a good excuse to get a steaming bowl of noodles. Simply delicious and unique. I dream about these dumplings and can't go too long between visits! To the person who complained that the staff is not friendly: just keep on going to Applebee's and stay away from this gem. These are professionals. They ain't in it for the flair.

This quaint little noodle eatery has a cool window through which you can view the hand-drawn noodles being prepared. I tried the fried tofu, which was excellent - a generous serving of little bricks of soft beancurd covered in a thin crispy-chewy batter, accompanied by a zesty dipping sauce. I also ordered the seafood noodle soup and specified rice noodles.  The rice noodles were pretty bland, which was not the best choice for a dish with relatively delicately flavored seafood; but keep that in mind that this is one dish that was really meant to be made with wheat noodles (the default version of the dish), which would also have given the dish the proper chew texture. Nevertheless, the broth was tasty and I will remember to order the wheat noodles next time. The dining area itself very basic but spacious, service was efficient, and the offerings are pretty inexpensive.

Noodles are cooked right, and taste so creamy-buttery! The family ordered different things, soup, stir-fry and braised noodles. Everything was yummy, although the service was not the best. They were not very attentive at times, and the girl that gave us our check, almost thwrew it at us (don't know if by accident) saying 'thanks for coming". The 4 stars are based on the food solely, service is lacking.
Beef stew noodle. The taste is okay, but a little salty.

This place is the real deal... Being next to Lee Lee's, I expected a run down Chinese restaurant (hole in the wall).  I walked into the complete opposite.  Great looking restaurant.  But that's not why I ever go out to eat.  I had their fried rice and it was spectacular (bargain too).  The first thing I noticed was that all the ingredients looked very clean.  It wasn't soaking wet with soy sauce.  Just the right amount of seasoning.  Perfect.  I can't wait to try their other meals.
Absolutely my favorite Chinese restaurant, I can't get enough of it.  No matter what you order, make sure to try the pan fried dumplings with it.

Very fun place to eat.  Super friendly and helpful staff allow you to understand this unique format for eating.  Great way to eat at your own pace and the food is light, full of variety, healthy and hugely flavorful.    Nice atmosphere that allows an intimate table for two or a decent sized group.  Comfortable, hip atmosphere.  BYOB allows you to not be disappointed with the wine list.  Great stuff!

I really love this place! I come here for their hand shaved noodles and usually order beef in xoxo spicy sauce and it's always delicious!  I've also had their soups before and love them too. My husband and I recently tried the dumplings-we got an assortment of steamed and pan-fried-and they were huge and really tasty. My husband usually gets cold dishes and recently had the beef noodles with a lemon and garlic sauce. He chose the thick noodles and they were incredibly long but he figured out a way to eat them easily and he ate everything!   They serve generous portions and I love that their servers are the perfect level of attentive (they come as soon as you sit and seem to know exactly when I'm ready to order). I also love that you can watch them make the noodles :). Definitely worth trying if you like noodles.

This place is hidden away in a little strip mall but SO great!. It is super clean inside.They have lovely padded highchairs for the baby.  There is a window to the kitchen where you can watch the very nice man (he always waves and smiles to the kiddos) pulling your noodles to order right when you ask for them. It keeps the kids happy and busy watching him twirl and stretch the dough. The portions are big and inexpensive.

An acquaintance of mine from out of town had recommended this place to some friends of mine this afternoon, saying that it was better than noodle places in Seattle, Washington, so we had checked it out. I had ordered iced coffee with boba, as well as #34- Beef with Fried Noodles in XO Spicy Sauce.   The order seemed to have been brought to us fairly quickly, and the portion was fairly large; thus a good amount for the price of $7.95. I have a high level of spice tolerance, and so the level of spice was not very high for me, and I had ended up adding Sriracha sauce. However, it tasted good, and I would recommend trying this dish.  Also, the server was very friendly and professional.
One of my friends recommended this place to me and the food was ok, but made me super sick! :(

I think this place went downhill since the last time I went which probably was 3-4 years ago, did they change the owner? The owner back then was a skinny tall lady  I ordered what I usually ordered "lamb soup". Now they don't ask what type of noodles I want anymore  Taste? The soup has no flavor and the lamb is too salty. Well, that combination works quite well I guess but still, the whole bowl is rather flavorless to me  Service? The waitress gave us really little time to look at what we wanted to order. However, the food is served very fast. Making me wonder if they already prepped it before hand.   Price? The price is cheap honestly. I don't think they changed the price at all since forever

I drove 45 minutes to get here. The place was chinatown cute and the menu looked bomb but the service was SKIMPY. They were nice enough but they seat you,, get your drinks/food to you and that's IT. We aren't high maintenance so it wasn't a big deal for us but I can see this being an issue for others.   3 of us got soups with different width noodles. I ordered the same type of noodles as my husband but when received, my noodles looked at least twice the width as his. The broth was ho hum just not enough of a savory type flavor and the noodles bland and tasted doughy. There were a couple things that were good (like the potstickers YUM, teriyaki chicken, fried tofu) but the general feeling at the table was an ehhhhhhhh :/  My  family politely chatted about maybe trying other items next time but I felt like there was alot of disappointment around the table (not to mention leftovers that no one wanted to take home).  Yelp-You totally let me down on this one :(

I think that the best part of this place is the authenticity. I went in and felt immediately at home. Family style seating, clean orderly seating, open windows, and you can even see them cook in the kitchen from your table!   I ordered the hand pulled noodles with spicy noodle sauce and the pork pan-friend dumplings. I wasn't enthusiastic about what I got though. I think what I expected was more of a Southeast Asian style, but what I got was East Asian. I wasn't a fan of the noodles in the sauce, but knowing where it was coming from, I think it would be excellent for the right person. The dumplings were large and intense. Two could have been a meal easily and were great for a side or appetizer, the sauce was sour and complimented the dumplings well, but the dough was almost too heavy for me. Again, I was expecting something lighter, but knowing now what they are, I'll get them when the time is right, but probably will go with a HK style dumpling next time.  The soups looked incredible, and I believe that most people in the restaurant had soup ordered, so I'll come back again and get that immediately. Each table was stacked with everything you'd need to eat: chopsticks, soup spoons, napkins, Siracha, soy sauce, etc. It was such an efficient place and the waiting-staff was great. If one was with a customer, the other was right there to help me out!  Thank you CMNH! I'll see you again and try something new!

Best little secret!  Handmade noodles.   Delicious every time!   We would recommend the wide noodles. More flavor. They will run out because they are made in house.   Our favorites are the beef noodles and the fried rice.   Also quick service to go  check it out!!

Everything on the menu is good. I usually get the chicken fried rice but I really like the dumplings and noodle soups (of course lol).  What i like most is the service -- everyone is friendly and the food comes out super quick. I would recommend it for weekday lunches if you only have an hour.

Amazing. Only regret is not going before now. Spicy beef noodle is the freshest flavor packed meal I have had in years. Lived and worked in San Francisco for years. I had given up on finding the same quality Chinese food in the Valley. I am very happily surprised and will be back

You can really tell the difference with the homemade noodles. They are wonderful. The spring rolls were kind of strange for me. I would not get them again. We had the 16C and beef stew with A. Both were very flavorful. We will be back.

This place is legit.   It's probably one of the few noodles houses in the Phoenix-area, unlike the myriad in California (which I so dearly miss).  I'm glad to see that the varieties of food are diversifying more and more now.  Anyways, grabbed lunch here with my mom earlier.  I got the zha jiang mian/noodles with minced pork sauce and my mom ordered the beef with fried noodles in XO spicy sauce.  The prices were relatively reasonable and the portions were generous, as you'll see from the pictures uploaded.  We both stuffed ourselves pretty well and still had leftovers to take home.  The dishes themselves were quite delicious, unlike anything else in Phoenix (at least in the East Valley).  The zha jiang mian/noodles with minced pork sauce wasn't too salty or overwhelming.  Just lots of thin noodles with ground pork with bits of garlic in a light brown sauce.  The dish was garnished with some green onions and raw cucumbers.  Definitely a good lighter dish.   The beef with fried noodles in XO spicy sauce was also quite appetizing, but a little on the oily side.  The waitress suggested we try the dish with the "shave noodles", which are hand-cut noodles that are wide, flat, and do not have a consistent shape unlike ordinary noodles.  The dish itself has a slight kick to it with some dried red chili peppers in it and contained a good helping of veggies and beef.  It even had a slight shiitake mushroom flavor to it, but there were no mushrooms to be found.  Either way, it was delicious.  Overall, my experience at this restaurant was pleasurable and I'd recommend it to anyone else looking to try a more authentic, less represented style of Chinese food here in the Valley.  *As an addendum: Food tends to come out quickly here so that is another big plus for this place.
Service was a bit slow, they forgot one of my parties order and joked about it after. Noodled were fresh and good, portion was a bit small, good price, and soup was okay.

It's really difficult for me to locate above average Chinese restaurants, but I was pleasantly surprised upon encountering this place next to Lee Lee's Market. I'd return for the spicy stir fry noddles.

I've been wanting to try this place since moving to Chandler last month and especially after reading the reviews.  Ordered take out tonight and it was absolutely delicious!  They take "carbs" to a whole new level :)  The noodles stand on their own....you can absolutely tell that they are homemade.  The thick noodles (there are several varieties) with minced pork sauce have a wonderful savory flavor and include diced cabbage and green onions.  The egg rolls were just as delicious and even the chicken fried rice (I know, rice at a noodle place?) was perfectly prepared.  This will definitely be another "go to" spot in lovely Chandler :)

Great food, awesome price, and the owner has never forgotten an order he took.  The prices have gone up a little since they first opened, but it's still very cheap, especially considering the portion size. I especially love the hot sesame/chilli oil that they have but it's kind of a hit and miss, Not always made right

The best Chinese food in greater Phoenix.  Hand made noodles that you can watch through the window.   The portions and prices are great.  They are a bit skimpy on the meat but regardless the dishes are not too salty or saucy.  I enjoyed the pan fried dumplings.

I went here with my husband on our date night and I must say, the noodles are delicious.  The texture had a nice bite to it, but not too al dente.  I had their beef noodle soup and my husband had their vegetable and beef fried noodles (lo mein).  Both were very good.  Best noodles I have had in AZ, hands down.  They only make one kind of noodle, but you can choose from a variety of shapes.    A warning however to those who have an aversion to certain meat sinew.  The beef that came in the my beef noodle soup came from, I believe, some cut of rib, straight off the bone.  So, although the beef was nice an tender, there were some pieces of sinew that were attached to most of my pieces of meat.  They were mostly tender, but some were a bit chewy.  Some people, like myself, actually enjoy eating these pieces of meat, but for those of you who don't, you might want to order a different kind of noodle soup.      We also ordered the pork steamed dumplings and the beef stick.I was not a big fan of the beef stick.  I think the cut of beef they use for the beef stick is not ideal for that type of treatment.  It was overdone, tough, and I wasn't too into the sauce.  I can't quite describe it except that it was a light soy sauce marinade, on the slightly sweet side, with little to no depth.    The steam dumplings were okay.  The dumpling skin is not typical; thin and delicate.  Simply based on the skin, they were very "hearty" dumplings.  I think they may use the same or similar dough recipe for their dumpling skins as with their noodles.  The filling was okay.  A bit on the mushy side for me and the sauce that they serve with it is lighter in terms of sweetness than most sweet and sour sauces.    The staff is very friendly and the prices are very reasonable.  Like my husband said, "any time I am in the mood for some noodles [Chinese wheat noodles specifically] I am coming here."
This place is very good.  They have 5 different noodles, good sauce, and fresh vegetables.  They also have a window to see the noodles being made in house.  Prices are decent as well.
Best hand made noodles hands down.   Spicy xo beef is my favorite with the wide noodles. Dumplings are very good too, just very big
Well worth a visit. #34 Beef w/ fried noodles in XO spicy sauce is bomb!! The #5 pan fried dumplings are also delicious and a meal in themselves.

I had the #34 with noodle C. The noodles were very good and the beef was tender. The dish was spicy enough to provide flavor, but did not overwhelm everything else.  I also enjoyed the #32 and the egg rolls.

so i discover this place through groupon, me and my fiance tried it out one day, its a bit far from where we live but since i save half price by  purchasing a groupon i figure the other half can pay for gas. plus since there's so much good reviews on this place.   i would say this place does have the best fresh noddles , my fiance order the beef noodle with broth, and i got the seafood fried noodles, they both tasted delicious i'm very satisfied with the place and food, its just if only my shrimp in the noodle i order were fresh and bigger shrimp and not frozen and tinny i'd definitely give a five star.im a big seafood person, i can taste when they're fresh or at least decent quality and when they're not.

If you crave authentic and freshly made Chinese egg noodled noodles,this restaurant delivers. It has a fairly unassuming presence and can easily be missed in the strip mall. Obviously Seafood Palace gets all the traction for dim sum, but we came here in the evening and were happy about our decision.  The first time I had flat wide fresh egg noodles, was in Xian in NYC. This is the only of the restaurant in Arizona that matched the quality.  We ordered Steve Jobs links, two flat noodle beef stews, medium sized noodle chicken stirfry, and sautéed  Chinese broccoli. The dumpling casing was so good and fresh that you could've eaten it even without the stuffing.  The soup bowls were packed with noodles and other ingredients. The flavor was flawless.  After eating for fantastic dumplings, I could only finish half of my soup.   The restaurant may not be fancy, but the food is done just right and deserves five stars.

We tried this place based on all of the great reviews.  It was hard to find, but we eventually made it.  It was crazy noisy inside too and quite hot.  I must say, while the flavors were good, and the fresh noodles were great, everything was quite greasy.  We drained a 1/4 cup of oil from our egg rolls onto a plate and napkin.  The fried noodles with chicken were also swimming in oil.  I may try one more time and get some that are not fried and hope that they are better.

Awesome noodle place that serves hand-pulled knife-cut noodles. If you doubt that these noodles are hand-pulled, just look through the window into the kitchen and get a glimpse of the chefs freshly making your noodles for you.  This is a pretty authentic Chinese restaurant that had many dishes to choose from I was in the mood for noodle soups so that's what I went for. I ordered the beef noodle soup and was offered a choice of 5 different noodles. They all looked good but I went with Option E (knife-cut) and absolutely did not regret my decision. The noodles tasted extremely fresh and the soup was quite brothy. I did add some Siracha sauce for extra flavor but the soup was good on its own as well.

I have been itching to go here for the fresh noodles which seems like forever. I ordered the beef with oyster sauce with flat wide noodles, I was expecting a nice dark, flavorful sauce but it was light & pretty mild. I wouldn't order it again. Other people with me got beef & chicken stir fry which I tried & it was PHENOMENAL! I didn't care for the dumplings because it was basically just meat with the dumpling wrapper. I will be back soon for some chicken stir fry!

We had high hopes based on previous reviews and were disappointed on all counts. Service was terrible. Our waiter stood with his back to us chatting with the other servers. He forgot our tea - not a huge problem except the water tasted like chlorine. Appetizers arrived after we were served the main course. The salt and pepper fish was good, but pretty flavorless. The vegetables and noodles were very salty. Vegetables were only cabbage and bean sprouts. The only reason this got two stars is the noodles were good.  Decor is basic- one step above school cafeteria.

This place is so good. I've tried a few items off the menu and I have yet to have something I didn't like. There were some complaints about the fried dumplings not being good, but idk what people are talking about! First of all, they're huge dumplings, so you get enough bang for your buck. Seriously, they're very good. If you go, you have to have their noodle dishes. My favorite noodle dish is the minced pork....so good! Also, idk why, but every time I go, I have to get the chicken teriyaki on a stick. So simple, yet so so good. I also always get one of their smoothies, usually with the tapioca or the coconut jello. Great place! You won't be disappointed.

Love, love, love this place. Everything I have tried here has been wonderful. My favorite are the shaved noodles and the dumplings! There is a window into the kitchen so my kids (and I) love to watch the cook hand stretch the noodles and make our soup.

I thoroughly enjoy the food here. Make sure you get the boiled peanuts and pickled radishes before your meal arrives. I usually get the egg noodle vegetable soup, perfect bowl of noodle soup when the craving hits. The tables have delicious hot chili oil to add to your liking. Shrimp fried rice is also great. Love to watch the hand pulled noodles too.
The hand pulled noodles were chewy and cooked perfectly. The sauce was not too salty or soy saucey. The fried rice was crispy and not overly cooked.
Amazing food! The noodles are the perfect texture. Love every dish I've tried here. Love that there's a large open window to view the back kitchen to see a behind-the-scenes view!

Amazing food by a great staff. We have been looking for a decent  noodle house since we left the culturally diverse Bay Area and we stumbled upon this gem.  I had the Beef Noodle soup and it was perfect, not too salty or too bland.  We also had the dumplings and they were not your tiny little frozen steamed and fried version these were obviously hand made and were full of meat. I would highly recommend this place and look forward to my next visit.

1. Bathroom is sparkling clean. Tells me te kitchen would be too.   2. Yes, handmade noodles...you can watch them do it all day long.  3. Stellar service both times.   4. Very VERY reasonable prices.   5. Omg best soup and wontons ever. For real. Seriously. Really really real for seriousness.   6. We are the only white people. All Asians eating here. This is key to knowing if an Asian restaurant is good.

I have been twice now.  The thing that assaults me as soon as I walk in the door is the smell of baby poop.  I have no idea what causes the smell but it is very strong.  My children noticed and mentioned it to me the moment they walked through the doors also.  The sat at the table with their noses plugged.  My kids liked the Deep Fried Tofu for $3.50 and it was a good portion size.  8 large chunks of tofu.    I tried the Braised Noodle with Sesame Paste (vegetarian) for $4.  It was so plain with very little taste.  Tasted slightly like peanut sauce.  I had to cover it in srarachi to get it down because I was so hungry.  Kids liked the Beef with Fried Noodles for  $7.95.  With the tofu it was enough food for my 3 kids that I brought home leftovers of both the noodles and tofu.  I tried the Vegetables with Fried Noodles on my first trip for $7.25.  They were just okay.  Even though the noodles are being made right there and you can watch through the window the taste was very similar to Panda Express to me.  Had three of the smoothies- Watermelon, Papaya and Strawberrry- all with boba.  The boba was pretty good but the smoothies weren't great.  I prefer Boba House around the corner in the same shopping center.  I don't think I will be back.

This place is delicious. Anytime I get a craving for savory I'm usually thinking I need to head to magic noodle. I love that you can watch the noodles being made in the window and that the service is so quick.   I get the wide noodles usually, and I've had some salt and pepper shrimp, and salt and pepper crab that I would leave a loved one for. No joke. I thought it was kind of hard to find at first and that the prices for drinks were pretty high, especially for a really small Thai tea, but eh, I guess I'll take that over any other place.

First-time hand pulled noodler here.  They're so great!  With a little bit of chew to them and the non-homogeneity to keep it interesting, and whatever flour they use is awesome.  They were like a cross between buckwheat soba and pho noodles in texture.  I want them all the time.  Three of us had soup noodles.  You pick your sauce/topping, then one of five kinds of noodles to go with it.  All three soups were super, with not too salty, flavorful broths and lots of meat.  I only wish there were more vegetables in my soup, but I guess it's a Chinese thing.    We also got the spicy pig ears.  The large is a waaaay big plate, and they come with a little bit of pickled vegetable slaw too.  My first time, I think, having pig ear.  I don't know how to describe it... gelled?  Firm?  It's worth trying just because the texture is so different from other animal parts, and because it's an interesting animal part, but I probably won't get it again.  Too much meat for me.  Quick, tasty, cheap.  Not the healthiest though.

They have really nice hand pulled noodles, with various choices of soup broth, or sauce and ingredients based.  They make the noodles here themselves and it is its key ingredient.  I like their beef noodles soup which comes with broth and pieces of beef.  One complain which leads to their 4 star is the lack of pieces of meat.  Noodles aplenty but the condiments and meat are not enough.  I had only a few pieces of lamb with my lamb noodles soup.  Do order their combination appetizer plate which comes with pieces of cold cut meats.  Also, the wait is very long if u come on the weekends and during lunch time.  Remember to flag down a employee and get a number, its pretty chaotic with no one at the front, but U need a number so U can get a seat when they have one.  But I will be back, for sure, thanks to their good noodles and tasty broth.

We have been trying pho and ramen places around Tempe and Chandler and this may be the best ever. the beef is perfectly tender and seasoned and the broth is so tasty one could drink it alone. Best this though...noodles. Hand made noodles that are so delicious and perfectly chewy! I ordered the XO beef with noodles and although it could be saucier and spicier but so tasty. Oh, they give you a tiny plate of boiled peanuts and kim chi to start which only gets you excited to eat their food. I'll be back!

First off, the portions are HUGE and the food quality is great! Delicious.  We ordered pan fried dumplings as an appetizer - they were huge and delicious - stuffed to overflowing. I think six came in the order, so there is a bunch to share with your friends.  We also ordered marinated pig ear, cold. It was good, but you have to like that kinda chewy texture. Maybe just a novelty to try, but good nonetheless.  I ordered the seafood soup with wide noodles. The noodles were fantastic - firm and chewy and fresh. You can even watch the guys make the noodles by hand through the window in the kitchen. The soup was loaded with shrimp, scallops, fish balls (like chewy meatballs), and a few veggies here and there.   My dad got the standard beef lo-mein or some such thing - he enjoyed it (and had a ton left to bring home). My mom got the beef soup with the skinny noodles - she enjoyed it also, especially the noodles.  I will definitely be back to try more stuff on their menu. It was busy at lunch time, but we only had to wait for like 10 minutes. Well worth it!
Fun spot! You get to watch them make your homemade noodles! Dumplings are large and enough for a meal. We will be back!
How fresh can noodles be?  They make it fresh by hand right in front of you.   The stir fried noodle with XO sauce is to die for.

I was not impressed! The staff was OK but I have to call into question the freshness. We ordered our food and literally our food was out in two minutes...and we ordered a lot. This was our first time (and the last time) here. We ordered egg rolls, dumplings, minced pork & beef in XO sauce. How could it ALL come out so fast AND be fresh? The noodles were lukewarm & microwaved, especially the minced pork dish. The egg rolls tasted refried and bland. My wife ordered hot tea which came warm in a plastic soda cup.The best part was the dumplings. Very good and one order is enough. We felt uncomfortable there, packed up a horrible meal & left. One to the next one!

Meh, just meh. I was sooooo excited to try this place and not just because it has the greatest name of all time. The noodles were good, don't get me wrong, I mean, you can actually watch the chef's pulling the noodles in the kitchen, but the food was just meh. I felt like it lacked flavor which was truly disappointing. The ratio of noodles to veggies in the chow mein was off. With all the other great Asian food options out there I don't really see myself coming back.

The restaurant contrary to alot of chinese restaurant it is a very clean establishment.  They even have an open kitchen!!!!  but if u were looking for good servise, this might be the wrong place for you, we all know with most of the authentic asian restaurant "good servise" doesn't really go with their menu. (haha just kidding, but no really the servise was just okay).  You can see the chef making the noodles from scratch through a display window it is actually cool.  If you are looking for a real "hand pulled" noodle house, this is it!!
Very good soup, as usual and the homemade noodles are awesome.  I didn't get condiments this time like they usually give with the soup ?????
Beef stew x Ox tail soup noodles, beef tendon and chef special, hot and spicy crawfish. Perfect combination on this chilly night  #chinamagicnoodlehouse

HUGE FAN OF THE POTSTICKERS! I also had the spicy noodles with the "thick noodles". They were good as well but next time i would try them with a smaller noodle. Staff was nice and helpful and on their recommendations the next time I visit i will try a few different things.

This is what I would say is a great Chinese joint with fast service and good quality food.  Be aware, this place is not Panda Express so don't come here and complain they don't have orange chicken.  That's not what this place is about.  It's about the noodles!  They do have a smaller menu with the variety really about the kind of noodle you can order (different widths and thickness of the hand made noodles).  Thus the aptly name of the shop.    My favorite things to get are their garlic green beans, mix of thinly slice beef parts (tendon, ear, and shank) and and their XO beef noodles.  The pan fried dumplings come out nice and hot and every time I have had them, it is crunchy on the bottom as it should be!  I have tried many of their noodle dishes and other than the XO noodles, the minced pork with sliced cucumbers noodles and beef noodles are my second and their favorite.  They do give a hearty portion of noodles.  I don't know why but I feel that the thinner noodles are better because the sauce and other flavor coat them better but that's just a personal preference.  Ultimately, what drives me back here even though it is in Chandler (and I live in Tempe, right next to ASU so it is a 20 min drive) is the reasonable prices and fast service.  They really do a great job and I have never in my years of eating here had to wait very long before the food comes. Yes, it is true the inside decor, chairs, and table are kind of worn and well-loved but who cares?  The chopsticks are clean and the food is awesome - that's all the Asians care about when it comes to food!  Just like in Taiwan - we'll happily sit on a bucket and  slurp down the cheap and great tasting noodles with the greatest of joy!

Good dumplings, they're huge! It's a meal in itself.   Stir fry noodles are great. I like the seafood better than the xo beef. Didnt really taste any xo sauce, seems like they just added a bit of chili oil and some whole fried chilis (like the ones that come in Kung pao)  Noodles with minced pork - I was skeptical at first because it didnt look promising based off the photos I've seen but it was really good. Good flavor.   Beef stew - will not order again. Beef was tough n chewy, not edible. Broth was bland.

I love this place! We used to live in chandler and we have dined in and gotten take out, never had any complaints. Take out is nice for the soups because the noodles come in a separate container from the broth, I usually keep some noodles in reserve and have used them to make my own stir fry noodle dish the next day or freeze them for later. The beef stew is my go to for the soups, but I also like the beef stir fry in spicy Xo sauce! We always get an order of the dumplings, they are huge and we always have left overs.   I overall would recommend this place, but as always it's not for everyone. You won't find New York style Chinese dishes here, but you will find delicious hand made noodle dishes and who doesn't love to support a local business!

It is magic that in this modern age that the noodles are not mass produced very far from my table.   One of the fun aspects of this place is the window in to the kitchen where they pull noodles. I had my back to it and managed to get a good amount of sauce on my short trying to catch a glimpse of the noodle artists in action.   The menu is a pretty good size, however there are only 3-4 vegetarian options.  The waiter was nice enough to make a few recommendations and modifications.   Prices are low about $7 per dish. The dishes are a bit on the Smaller side for us big Americans so if you have a few people get 1 extra and share.  We had the veggie noodles and noodles with sesame paste. The veggie ones were quite familiar with the wake taste beansprouts and other veggies  The one with the sesame paste was great, but could have used a veggie to offset the texture.  bottom line fun place good food but limited veg options.
A well deserved 5 star restaurant. Cheap and authentic. Fresh pulled noodles everyday. Fast service, lots of space and clean environment.

Must have some Asian food....  Okay, I packed up the kids and headed for Lee Lee's Market.  As I turn into the parking lot I saw the Noodle House.  "You guys want to have noodles for lunch?"  I asked my niece, nephew and son.  "Yes!"  they replied.  Almost all kids love noodles.  I only know of one kid that does not like any type of noodle or pasta.   We were seated right away.  My niece informs me that the table smelled funky.  I had them re-wipe it once more.  Then out comes the boiled peanuts and sweet pickled daikon and carrots.  That explains it!  The vinegary pickled daikon is to blame.    There are poster sized pictures of the dishes on the walls in case you want to know how your dish should look like.  It's about 100 degrees and we felt like eating Ox tail soup and seafood soup ($5.75 each).  I asked for 3 extra bowls for sharing.    Hours of boiling soup bones lend to the beefy broth of the ox tail soup loaded with ramen, baby spinach and other greens.   Not much meat, but I really like the broth.  The seafood soup consisted of shrimp, bay scallops, fried fish balls, squid, ramen noodles, spinach and other greens and herbs.  The kids enjoyed their meals.  We'll be back to try the other dishes.  Awesome prices, too!
Freshly made to order hand pulled noodles in stir fry or soup style with huge pan fried potstickers all house made. Great to eat in or take out!
Noodles just didn't taste good. Good presentation of how the noodles were made, but it did not taste right.

Definitely the type of place where there may be some hit or miss dishes but the hits will keep you coming back.  One of those places where i'll crave it frequently.  The noodles are always nice and fresh with a good consistency.

I just polished off a few things and I'm actually having a hard time figuring out what I liked most.  Ordered the #34 per another user's recommendation and it is pretty not bad - definitely spicy!  Enjoyed the pan fried dumplings - fat and flavorful!  Very tasty - definitely a re-do.  And ordered the #56 Salt and Pepper Shrimp.  Wasn't sure what to expect with that one, but it's basically tempura shrimp with sliced jalapenos on a bed of lettuce.  Good enough for me - I topped my noodles with the extra roughage from the shrimp and kept going.  I'd go on, but I really need another drink and something to keep my nose from running - it was nice and spicy, oh so worth it.  Will be going back to explore more options!

This is by far the best Chinese place in Chandler. It's super cheap and you get tons of food, and the noodles are fantastic (and also hand pulled).   I have always ordered the seafood hand-pull noodle plate with handpull noodles. Take out or eat in, this is a great option for anyone who needs to eat fast (they normally operate very quickly).

This place is always amazing..  The noodles are made fresh and you get to choose the thickness or thinness and style of noodle you like.  They don't speak great English there and I was trying to get them to find a way for a newsletter to remind me they exist because the place is fantastic but I always forget but to go there.  There are large portions and the price is definitely definitely affordable

Loved every last noodle. Which, might I add, are homemade and there's a window you can look through to watch them make your dinner. There are multiple shapes to choose from as well.   My friends and I came here and got the seafood noodle plate which resembles a Chinese Alfredo, sliced beef noodle soup and vegetable egg noodle soup with spinach, cilantro, and green onions. All three dishes came with a heaping mound of noodles and none of us finished.   Prices were great! $5.75-$9 for a ginormous serving.  Good service! Ladies were super helpful and nice.   If you're in the area and want some great noodles, please oh please, come here. Delish.

This is the most authentic Chinese noodle restaurant in town.  I lived in China for 10 years, and it is great to speak to the owners in mandarin.  The food is very delicious, and with a wide variety of hand pulled noodles.  One of the best parts is the window to the kitchen.  Have you seen noodles pulled by hand before?  Well here instead of seeing pizza dough being tossed, it's noodles.  And it is nothing like you would imagine!

I've been coming to Arizona since 2014,  I discover this restaurant totally by chance but I like it so much that I keep coming back for more,  my nephew moved here to chandler since November last year and he and his wife love it and will come back again

Husband, step-son and I went here for Christmas Day lunch.  We all agreed it was so very, very tasty!  We ordered steamed dumplings.  YUM!  Next time that is ALL I will order. :)  I had the chicken and noodles dish, which I think was much better than my companions dishes.  Husband had beef and step-son had pork.  They both liked my chicken and noodles dish.  I can't remember the number on the menu.    If you are looking for great ambiance, décor, etc, forget it.  You won't find it here.   We prefer hole in the wall places like this where we always find great food.  No language barriers for us...service was prompt and friendly.    Definitely a great find for us!  Jeez, now I have to go wipe the saliva from the corners of my mouth.

I like this place.  Hand pulled noodles are awesome and I love how fobby it is!    This place gets awesome-points for hand pulled noodles, looking like Taiwan, inexpensive pricing, big portions, and the large window that allows you to look into their kitchen and watch the guy make noodles.  I must say I'm hard on Asian restaurants because I've eaten lots of Taiwanese/Chinese cuisine in the bay area and LA.    The food here is authentic.  The taste is pretty good if you order the right things.  The beef noodle soup could be better; if you do have a hankering for "hong shao niu rou mian", this will allieve it but you'll probably think there's something missing from it.  Favorites:  Noodles in spicy sauce (vegetarian) Beef noodles with oyster sauce

Their noodle soups are Great, I would have to rate them beyond expectation. I've been to Taiwan and tried Taiwanese noodle, this place is IT. The waiters known us by name. Since I always come here after stop by the boba shop next door, one time I didn't bring my boba and the lady owner even gave me their Boba free of charge. Great food, Great price, Great service.

Kids and I ate there on Friday 9-24-10 for dinner.  Not being "regulars" to this sort of food, we did not really have any idea what to expect.  The kids loved watching the dude pulling the noodles.  They each gave him a dollar in his tip jar.  We loved the ground seasoned pork on hand-pulled ramen-sized noodles.  5 Stars for that puppy.  The oxtail soup was "OK" as was the beef noodle soup.  Not overly salty, but really, not a LOT of taste.  It did not make any of us say, "Yum Yum !!" after the first bite.  All in all, an average meal.

This is the most authentic CHINESE style ramen I've had in AZ. The best thing is that the noodle is made fresh. You can even see the chef toss/stretching the dough through the glass. The beef in the beef noodle soup is very tender, which is a plus plus in my book! The beef stew broth was also very flavorful. A bowl of noodles was only $7! I'll be going back real soon!

Tried this place it for the first time with my boyfriend and everything was delicious!!! We shared the pan fried dumplings which were delicious. He and I each got our own entree but it was entirely too much food. He ordered the beef stir-fry with spicy xo sauce. Holy cow!!!!! His was amazing! By far the best noodles I've had. I got a chicken stir fry with shaved noodles and that was amazing too. Loved watching the noodles being made and the staff was attentive and friendly.

If you are a fan of potstickers this is the place for you.  It's been a bit since I have been here and my memory is a bit fuzzy on the details but I do remember some amazing potstickers that were enormous and enough to make a meal out of at a fair price. I remember they were full of meat and the noodle case was not to thick but enough to hold things together when you cut into it and provide solid doughy goodness not the slimy sort found elsewhere.    Half the reason I'm doing this review is so I remind myself to come back with a group of friends to try some more of menu items and share an order of potstickers so I don't leave over stuffed.   I will be sure to update my review when I get back over there.

Visited here a few more times & tried a few more dishes but just can't get over the overly doughy noodles in both soup & stir fry.  Guess this style of noodles is not for me after all.  At least the service got a little better now.

This is a smallish interior sparsely decorated home made noodle house. No a lot of English is spoken here but communication wasn't difficult. The steamed dumplings to start were ginormous! Beautiful flavor and done just right. From the menu you pick what you want and then your size of noodle. I got the seafood soup with wide noodles. Hot and fresh it arrived with so much parsley on the top it over took all of the soup flavor. Seafood was done right but no flavor whatsoever to the broth other then parsley. Next time I will considering ordering chicken or pork so the broth will have flavor. Make sure to bring your chopstick skills, not a fork in sight. (I'm sure if we asked we would have gotten one). Tables were slightly sticky.... all and all, good fresh food at a very reasonable price. AND you get to watch them make noodles!!!

So exciting to have a local restaurant that makes chinese noodles from scratch.  The noodles at China Magic Nodle House are delicious (and cheap)!  The decor is typical little-Phoenix-strip-mall, but the environment is NOT why you come to a place like this!  I like noodle dishes where you can actually taste the noodles...can't go wrong with the beef chow fun.  I am excited to return to try some of the other noodle dishes.
Just one word.... Perfect  Hand pulled noodles to order. Beef in XO sauce is my main go to however the dumplings are the size of your head. Well not really just the size of golf balls

I went based on an article in the New Times.  I ordered the fried noodles with chicken, and my girlfriend ordered noodles with spicy sauce.  Both were great.  The menu isn't very friendly to those not familiar with asian food, but it had a very good selection.  I want to go back and try one of their soups...they looked wonderful.   Also, it's fun to watch the noodles being made by hand.

I am in love with this joint. Let me break it down to you, there is something very magical about the handcrafted noodles and the seasoning of the broth. Every time I visit Arizona, I have to make a pilgrimage here. I don't care if the weather is blazing over 100 degrees in the summer or dropping down to 20 degrees in the winter desert; I just have to come and get my fix. The lady owner is super sweet and the waiters are also very attentive and nice. (Also if you're feeling under the weather and need some soup, this is such an ideal place.) Otherwise, for all the Cantonese people in the area who need their soup fix, this is it. Lastly, the food is very affordable, hence why I love this place!
Love this place, always get the spicy stir fry noodles. I should try something else, but when it comes time to order I have to get #34.

I lalalove this place! A friend came with and enjoyed it too! The food was great, the restaurant is clean. We had the shaved noodles with pork, regular noodles with beef, chicken fried rice (real chicken), and pan fried dumplings! Leftovers are delicious!

Surprisingly Great.  Was not sure by the looks of the place, but don't be fooled.  This place is Da Bomb.  I'm a huge Chinese Food fan and this place did not disappoint.   Fried rice Broccoli rabi  Shrimp and corn curry noodles (this was the best surprise dish) Stir fry (we had 4 different ones) Dumplings are HUGE and delicious

Ordered the vegetable noodles and substituted the boiled egg for a fried one (how I like to eat it). Noodles were delicious and fresh. Only downside is that "vegetable" meant a little bit of spinach and some cilantro.   The pan-fried dumplings were surprisingly the best part of the meal. Really chunky dumplings with lots of meat inside and fresh tasting skin.   Would definitely go back!

They know how to cook but service appears to be a problem.  The taste and quality of their dishes are a five but service is a two at best.  Let me give you an example.  We ordered egg rolls, pan fried dumplings, the Seafood (Shrimp, Scallops, Squid & Fishball) with Soup Noodles,  and Beef With Stir-Fried Noodles In Xo Spicy Sauce.  Everything was delicious but the order of served dishes was funky!  After just a few minutes they brought my son's soup, hot and steaming.  He thought he could wait until they delivered my noodle dish and of course our appetizers.  About ten minutes later out came my noodles, hot steamy and delicious.  Another 10 minutes and the eight huge dumplings were brought to the table.  We were finishing up our food and asked what happened to the egg rolls and they replied they were coming.  Five minutes later they brought the egg rolls which we ate as our dessert!  The food is too good not to return, but I will be sure to quarterback their delivery so I can eat in the appropriate order.

I got their spicy stir fry and it was really good.  I also got their dumplings steamed and it has just meat in it, no veggies, and its better fried.  The restaurant has the hot oil chilli sauce as well as sriracha so thats cool.  It was my first time going, and id probably come back to try more of their menu!

We like this place.  The noodles are always fresh (they make them, and you can watch them!), and the food always tasty.  The quality of the service depends on how busy they are and which server you get.  If they're busy the service is spotty even with the better server.  This visit we got the server who doesn't seem to want to be there.  She's mostly indifferent but if you ask for stuff she will bring it.  The food is good.  Some of the best noodles anywhere.  We will keep coming back as long as that is true.
They have authentic chow mein. My favorite is Beef chow mein with XO sauce. It tastes like the ones I used to have on the side of streets when I was in college in China.

Just your average hole in the wall Chinese restaurant. I got the Mongolian Beef and all I can really say about it is that it is average. If you're in the area and craving Chinese food this is definitely a good fix but I wouldn't go here unless I was already nearby.

This place has amazingly low prices and really fast service.   The atmosphere of this place is pretty authentically Chinese. I could imagine seeing a place like this in Chinatown. I'd categorize food as Asian comfort food. There's nothing incredibly flashy about any of their dishes, but it always hits the spot. The prices are also incredibly low, even by Arizona standards. You're pretty much guaranteed to be really full while spending less than $10.   Despite the low prices, the service here is actually very good. Waiters are patient and will get your food out to you very fast. They don't have that slightly rude attitude that a lot of Chinese places will have. The employees are also really helpful and will make suggestions if you are overwhelmed by the incredible number of noodle options. There have also been many times when someone at our table orders some sort of combo and our waiter has suggested that he order it in a different manner that would produce the same results with cheaper pricing. The one problem is that, once in a while you get a waiter who speaks mostly Chinese. This isn't usually an issue for me, but if this is your first time coming here as a nonChinese speaker, I'd imagine it could be a little off putting.  I recommend this place if you're looking for someplace cheap, fast, and filling. I know I definitely will be back next time I swing by AZ.

The quality and freshness of the ingredients is 2nd to none.  They are known for noodle dishes obviously and the "Noodles in Soup" as it says on the menu are remarkable. You can customize your order if you like (i.e. add fried egg)  Handmade noodles are made at time of ordering. This is ever so apparent in the window to the kitchen where all the "magic" ;) happens.  All the noodle soups I've tried have been very good. So far the only broth I did not like was the chicken which I did my best to doctor up using the condiment carousel of soy sauce, vinegar, hot chili oil and sriracha. My favorite dish they make is noodles with minced pork sauce....I drool just thinking about it.  For my personal experience, dine in customer service was more enjoyable than take out customer service.  Don't forget that Lee Lee's market is in the same plaza so you can pop in there while you're in the area.  This one of a kind noodle place is definitely worth the drive across Valley!

Don't let the outside of the place fool you, the inside is a regular hubbub of activity. You can watch full grown adults try to inconspicuously push other smaller adults and children out of the way whilst smushing their face up against the glass window to get a better view of the chefs hand pulling noodles. It's simply mesmerizing to watch. Not only was there prime window watching going on but the rest of the place was crazy busy too. Packed full of people and for a reason because the food is delicious, prices are beyond reasonable and the service is solid.

I've been here quite a few times and I always order the same thing over and over. Pan fried Dumplings and X.O stir fry noodles with beef.  I love how the noodles are freshly made here. You can actually see them make the noodle through the window. The prices here are reasonable.   What I love about the X.O. Noodles are the spices and fresh noodles mainly. I am not really a big fan of the beef here it just taste slimy for some reason. They probably use some type of flour to make the beef wet and slimy. I think it would've taste better with hand cut steak.   The service here is great the food came out quickly and we got our water refilled before even having to ask. Good job on that!

The menu at China Magic Noodle House represents the school of thought that if you're going to make just one thing, it's got to be good. They pretty much only serve one thing -- noodles.  Located in the Lee Lee shopping center in Chandler, the owners have done a great job of making the interior bright, clean and welcoming. Greeted with a smile, we were seated in the one of the generously sized booths, as if they knew about the feast we were going to order.  On the farthest wall a large window provides a view of the kitchen where the magic happens. After you place your order, you're welcome to go to the window and watch the noodle master go to work. Each order is hand pulled, something that's amazing to witness. I was put into a foodie-induced trance while he twisted and beat the dough. The noodle master makes it look so easy, but it takes a ton of practice and skill honing.  Wanting to attack the menu from all sides, we ordered a Chinese noodle feast. When the first dish arrived we knew we were in for a treat. The huge made-by-hand Pan Fried Dumpling ($4.95) was stuffed with seasoned minced pork. Alongside was a bowl of a vinegar-based dipping sauce, which brought a bright tang to each pork bite. I enjoyed the fact that the skin was thick since each bite was substantial and toothsome.  The Hot Spring Beef Tender ($4.50) was kind of a surprise when it arrived. My impression when ordering this dish was that it would be tender sliced beef, but when it arrived it was a plate full of paper-thin slices of spiced marinated beef tendon. I love beef tendon, so it wasn't much of a problem. Our waiter explained that the tendon is tender, and pointed out that the Marinated Beef ($4.50) was sliced beef.  There's a choice of five types of noodles, but we homed in on the hand-pulled version. They also offer wide noodles, shaved noodles, thick noodles and vegetable noodles.  Noodles with Minced Pork Sauce ($5.50) offered chewy bites studded with green onion and little pieces of ground pork. The noodles did a great job of absorbing all of the flavors of the dish. I'd order this one again.  Beef with Fried Noodles in XO Spicy Sauce ($7.95) is similar to a house lo-mein, but this was bursting with taste.
