The Spicy XO Sauce added a salty and savory dimension to the noodles and tender beef that was indeed spicy, but not overly so. If you need additional spice there is a jar of red chile oil on every table.  I jumped at the chance to try their version of Homemade Lemonade ($2). Sweet and tangy, this is how good lemonade should be made. The Homemade Lemon Tea ($2) pretty much bests any other Arnold Palmer. Both drinks did a great job of cutting through the richness of the highly flavored noodle dishes.  Similar to Vietnamese pho, Ox-Tail with Soup Noodles ($5.95) were so comforting, I can imagine these on a cold day warming your belly and your soul. The broth was complex and each bite of fall-off-the-bone tender ox-tail and chewy noodles were a joy to slurp.  The only negative thing I can say about China Magic Noodle House is that they aren't closer to where I live, though on second thought, this might be a good thing.

I've been here a few times but today was the first time a tried the pan fried dumplings. So delicious! And gigantic portions. It could be a whole meal itself. The noodles taste so good and fresh. And I can't help but get a strawberry smoothie every time I come. Service is quick and friendly. They really know the menu too! Love this little gem

First time getting hand-pulled noodles, and they were not bad!    Fried noodle w/beef, and thick noodles ($8).  The noodles were thicker than the chopstick and had a distinct chewiness to them, which i enjoyed.  Despite being a noodle dish, there wasn't much noodles.  There also wasn't a lot of beef, but there was a ton of veggies.  Lastly, there is a viewing window customers can walk up to and watch the chef work his hand-pulled noodle magic.

This place is the best!!! They make the noodles fresh to order and even have a little viewing window so you can watch them make it. The prices are reasonable and the staff is super friendly. I love coming here.

Do you like Potstickers?  I mean GIANT Potstickers?  Then you have to check this joint out.  Located in what I call the "Asian Corner" of Chandler (Dobson / Warner) this place serves up the best Potstickers around.  Not only are they the best, they are the Biggest you will ever see.  Usually you think of Potstickers  as an appetizer, right?  Well, not these babies; they are an enormous serving of 8 huge dumplings, pan fried or steamed.  This is a serious meal in itself and I can not finish a plate of these by myself.  Okay, enough about the Potstickers.  All their noodles are handmade and spun in house.  There is a kitchen window so you can watch them work their magic!  Whether you're a Potsticker fan, or just fresh Asian noodle fan, hit them up, you won't be disappointed.

Awesome, awesome, awesome! Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants. We go here probably once a week. The servers make an effort to know you and your order, which is always appreciated. The food is fresh and delicious always. You get to see the cooks make and stretch the noodles! Very good prices. The atmosphere is nice for a quick serve place, and it's always clean. Basically, we love this place and would definitely recommend.

Authentic. Very good pot stickers and egg rolls. Be prepared, the noodles are not like Top Ramen, they are more like what you would get in China. They do give you a questionable smelling plate of pickled things when you are seated, expect the smell but don't let it put you off.

I guess a lot of people come here for their hand pulled noodles... but I'm not the biggest fan of those.... If you like the thicker style noodles, then I think the hand pulled noodles is worth trying.  This place is definitely different from other chinese places, so its a good change from typical chinese restaurants.

Dinner and a show! It's the only place I have found in Arizona to get ??? Dao Xiao Mian or Knife Cut Noodles, and fortunately they do a fabulous job with them! The hand cut noodles are thick with a great chewy mouth feel. The pot stickers are fantastic, we get an extra to-go order every time. The orders are prepared quickly and it's fun to watch them through the kitchen window as they pull the noodles and the stir-fry flames up.  This place has authentic Chinese noodles and to me it's well worth the hour it takes to get there! I usually order a watermelon slush and drink it with a straw because I am used to it. That's punny in Chinese. ;-)
The noodle here is not very good. It was not cooked thorougly. I warn you. Do not get the smoothies. I think 7-11 slush tasted much better than this crap

I've heard so many good things about this place so we checked it out. Food was bland. We found a long hair in our noodle they remake it for us no big deal. It might have been an off day but we were disappointed.

best chinese noodle in town! unlike japanese ramen(which i really love also), chinese noodle has its own different unquie broth, the one i usually get is the lamb soup, always keeps me warm during the winter,even though in az its pretty short lol. and other cool things about the noodle is they all hand made by the noodle chief, so the bite texture on the noodle is way better than the instant noodles.

Drove all the way from the West side just to eat at this place, and it was worth it. The spicy cold cuts (beef, tendons and pig's ears) made it all worth it. Also ordered dumplings, noodle stir fry with beef and noodle ox tail soup. Love the noodle ox tail soup also. The others were okay. This place definitely has awesome noodles. I got mango smoothie with boba and it was meh....it was diluted. The service was good and quick. Would definitely go back here for another cold cuts order and another noodle dish.

Next to Lee Lee market which makes it a convenient place to run into before going grocery shopping.  You can watch the chefs make the incredible noodles.  This is the first place in Phoenix with actual hand pulled noodles which is an art.  I can't imagine the patience and skill it takes to transfor simple ingredients like flour, water and salt into these beutiful noodes.  From flat and broad, to thin and delicate, they have all styles. The different styles of noodles will complement different types of sauces and toppings.  The waiters are pretty good at recommending the right kind of noodle for the type of toppings.  Tea costs extra (which is a little annoying), but other than that I can't really complain.  You know it's good when about 90% of the restaurant is made up of hungry Asian folks :)

So this place is pretty good overall -- depending on what way your preferences lean.  The service is amazingly fast!!! We had our food coming out in less than 10 minutes (o-o).  It was also a lot of fun to watch them make the noodles through the big picture windows.  The portions are VERY large - definitely enough for left-overs - and the prices are very reasonable.  The food is good, but not necessarily special or memorable.  The appetizer menu is nicely diverse, but as far as main dishes go it is essentially a choose your meat and sauce kind of gig.  For my tastes it may have been a bit too salty, but hey some people are in to that sort of thing.  Health wise the food is probably 80% carbs (I mean the restaurant name has noodle in it so no surprise there right), 19% meat, and maybe 1% veg.  They do have a gluten-free option of rice noodles FYI.   TLDR: If you are looking to fill up the tank quick and cheap then give this place a try.  If you are looking for something more healthy or tasty then maybe keep driving ;-)

Worst customer service i have ever had. Cant believe this place is reviewed so high. They should seriously change out the staff. The food was okay not as good as i expected it to be based off the reviews. Expecially since this place has been reviewed by food critics (Howard Seftel to name one) which i think might have been paid off by this restaurant. That critic must have not been a true food critic and is most likely looking for a free meal because this place is at best a 3 star and thats if the staff had any normal manners.
The best stir fried noodles ever!! I came to this place three times an each time the food has been amazing! They make their noodles in house and it's too die for!

Don't worry about the fact that this is in a strip mall, or the Chinatown decor, sit down, preferably near the window & get ready for the show.  I ordered pan fried pot stickers, which were easily the best I've ever had.  Then the fresh mango juice, best I've had since I lived in Brazil & cut the mangoes off the tree.  The spicy pan fried noodles with beef (#34) were flat out incredible.    With prices that are pretty close to what they charge at Panda Express, the food is easily ten times better.  The noodles are scratch made, fresh for every order, and you can watch them slapping & pulling the noodles through the window if you have the right seat.  Go here, even if you order ahead & take it to go.  You won't regret it!

A nice sit down restaurant despite it not being anything fancy. I wasn't expecting too much when I went to dinner here with the boyfriend and his family. I did get excited when I saw that they hand make all their noodles here.   The menu is pretty extensive with a variety of different noodle dishes with "less Americanized" appetizers and veggies such as marinated pig ears, beef tendons, and yu choi. But that doesn't seem there isn't something for everyone. Their menu also lists the different types of noodles you can choose with your dish, along with a close up photo of each.   Since I'm normally not a huge noodle soup fan, I decided to go with #22 which is the Noodles with Minced Pork Sauce. I LOVE minced pork so I thought it would be hard to go wrong with this dish. Andddd, I wasn't wrong. First off, the dish is HUGE. They definitely do not skimp out on the portions. It was a very filling two meals for me, and for only about $8! I recommend getting the thick noodles since they are so chewy and delicious. My boyfriend opted for the regular noodles since his friend mentioned that that was his usual order, but he didn't like it as much as mine. The noodles come with a generous topping of minced pork, slices of cucumber, and cabbage. It gets even better near the end with the collection of sauce on the bottom!   I also got to try #34 which is the Beef with Stir-Fried Noodles in XO Spicy Sauce. Also very good and more like a chow mein dish. (So a good rec for someone who isn't used to eating different types of Chinese food).

Ho ho ho It's China Magic you know Never believe, it's not so It's China Magic you know Never believe, it's not so (Lyrics - E.L.O. - Oh oh oh It's Magic)  China Magic Noodle House is located in the heart of what I call the Asian Center!  Yes, right on Dobson and Warner is where all the my Asian peeps hangout - haha!  CMNH is both a specticle and an eatery.  The man behind the glass window stretches and spins noodle dough while you watch in amazment.  How does he do that!?  Needless to say, he is spinning your noodles up and around the air.    This time around I ordered the Stir Fry Noodles with spicy X.O. Sauce, while my bro ordered the Ox tail soup with noodles.  I must say my noodles were a tad bit hard, but I ordered the "D" noodles which were the large flat noodles.  I would recommend the spaghetti style since I think they would cook better.  With 5 different styles you can't lose!  My bro's Ox tail soup looked interesting, but he said it was OK at best so I'm going to have to take his word for it.    Overall, I really enjoyed the hand made noodles and the different ways they cook it up.  The best part is being able to watch them make the noodles.  For what you pay for I think it's awesome.  Some dishes start at $5 -- where else can you find that aside from Mc-d's! - Enjoy!

I'm obsessed with Chinese Magic Noodle House. I have to admit, after growing up in Beijing and finding only decent hand-pulled noodle restaurants in the San Francisco Bay Area, I didn't have high hopes for Chinese food in the Phoenix area. Admittedly Chandler is a half hour's drive away, but I've happily made the trek three times in the past couple of weeks, and I definitely haven't been disappointed.   Located in a small strip mall, the restaurant is simple yet functional. The furniture may be a bit dated, but the food more than makes up for that. There is a little window where one of the cooks is hand-pulling large hunks of dough for the noodles, and that reminds me so much of similar displays in Beijing.  There are several options for which kinds of noodles customers would prefer, but I highly recommend the thick hand-pulled noodles for almost every dish. The noodles here are amazing, and I'm especially a fan of the noodle soups. The beef noodle soup is probably my favorite, followed by the ox tail noodle soup, dry tossed noodles with ground pork, and XO sautéed noodles with beef.   Beef noodle soup: This is a heavier soy sauce based noodle soup with large chunks of tender beef. I like that the soup is slightly saltier to allow for the flavor to permeate through the noodles, but not so salty that the broth is undrinkable. This is hands down my favorite preparation for the thick hand-cut noodles.  Ox tail noodle soup: This is a much lighter noodle soup when compared to the beef noodle soup, as the ox tail is sliced into thin pieces and the broth is clear. I thought that some of the cook on the ox tail was uneven, as there were pieces which were overly chewy and others that were tender. A good choice for when I'm hoping for a lighter broth, but I felt that the beef noodle soup was a hard one to beat.  Dry noodles with ground pork: This was a decently good dish, although the lettuce strips on the bottom instead of cucumber strips were a bit unconventional. The thicker noodles can be harder to navigate in this version, but they were still tasty. I could have used a bit more sauce, but the ground pork was seasoned well and paired nicely with the fragrant noodles.  Sautéed noodles with beef and XO sauce: I was so impressed that the thick noodles weren't overlooked or undercooked in this dish, as I've had so many versions where the noodles were mushy and falling apart. The XO sauce was a bit heavy for my taste, but I could tell that the wok breath was fragrant and ingredients timed well. This was a far step up from the stir-fried noodles at Cherryblossom Cafe in Phoenix.   Potstickers: These were huuuuge! I don't know if I've seen potstickers this big, and truthfully they were more of dumplings than anything else. I thought that with such thick wrappers and hand-made, these would probably have been better if prepared in the traditional boiling of dumplings; it's just hard to steam such large portions adequately through pan-frying. The flavor was still good, but I'd pick noodles over these potstickers without hesitation.  I'll be back soon!
China Magic Noodle House is my go-to place for Chinese comfort food. I always order the pan fried dumplings and beef stew noodle soup with "thick" noodles. Highly recommend.

So the first time, I really loved this place.  The second time.... I have fallen out of love. The noodles (esp the shaved noodles) are still great, but the portions are smaller and the quality has just gone down.   On our latest trip, the husband decided to venture from our norms\ and ordered the lemon beef noodles - which was really really.... interesting. Not terrible, just interesting. The beef is the cold sliced beef you get on those appetizer plates, and is bathed in a sweet-lemony sauce. It was alright. The saving grace was the shaved noodles we got. I basically ate this dish because I love the noodles.   We also ordered the combo seafood noodles with the thick round noodles. I think it was composed of maybe 4 super looooooong noodles and couple teeny pieces of shrimp, 3 miniscule baby scallops, and a couple slivers of octopus/squid. and a whole lotta celery and cabbage.   The best thing we ordered was the blistered long beans. Sigh.   I might be back IF I'm in the area and IF I'm craving some shaved noodles, but aside from that, I wouldn't make a special trip to dine here.

I ordered one of the beef noodle soup bowls. Like other Chinese noodle bowls, I find that the broth flavor is a little lacking compared to ramen or pho. The noodles were delicious though and the meat was great. The service was pretty fast and you have the option of buying boba. I didn't get the boba but I will next time.  I give the place A-OK just because the noodle bowls didn't impress me much flavor wise. The saving grace was the fresh noodles made in house.

I have been wanting to try China Magic Noodle for a long time because I heard that their noodle soups are pretty authentic and they pull the noodles by hand. Although it is true that the noodles are hand-pulled, and you can watch this process through the window in the back, I found the noodles to be a little undercooked. I was initially suspicious when our orders came so quickly. After tasting it, I realised that the noodles were a little too hard (undercooked). I allowed the noodles to sit a little longer in the broth to soften up, but it's just not as good as digging into a perfectly prepared bowl of noodle soup.
Great noodles and other traditional Chinese food. Portions are huge so you'll definitely leave happy.
The potstickers here are a-mazing! Noodles are fantastic. Fried rice was nothing special, but still flavorful.

Decent hand pulled noodles. It looks dim from the outside but on the inside..it's really spacious and clean.  there is a lookout window to watch the Chinese Chef pull noodles. He'll do a demonstration and there is a tip jar by the window.  Noodles are $6.50-$7.50 a bowl.   There are different appetizer (pig ear specialty but I did not try it)   COME HERE TO EAT instead of BEIJING #9 Noodles in Vegas  CASH ONLY
Delicious broth! Fun to watch them make the noodles :)

I don't understand some of the low ratings. The food was wonderful and the service was prompt and courteous. The noodles are the best I've had! If you aren't used to firmer and fresh made noodles don't come here. If you prefer over cooked store bought noodles you will be disappointed.   Culturally if you disapprove of the food you don't outright complain as it is seen as extremely shameful and rude! If you disapprove then don't eat the food and leave. A full plate left is also insulting but a more acceptable way to show your dissatisfaction. If you don't care about cultural customs then just be a typical un cultured person and whine.   Besides all the formalities this is truly a gem of a restaurant as most(99.9%) don't bother making their own noodles. If you like the best noodles outside of expensive places than this is the place!     I had the pork noodle stir fry and it was excellent! It was out to me hot and prompt in about 8 minutes! The service was friendly and I will return :)

They serve the best Chinese style noodle in Arizona. You are able to try from soup noodle to fried noodle, from hand-pull to shaved noodle. They can be very thin or very wide. Price is reasonable. My favorite is beef stew with soup noodle. Cannot get enough!

I ordered beef with stir-fried (shave) noodles in XO spicy sauce today and it tastes really good! Before my boyfriend always suggested me to have ox-tail with soup noodles, but the noodle was sometimes a little bit plain and floury if only goes with beef soup. I dont hate it but just cannot finish the bowl all the time. But today I keep eating fried noodle until i cannot fill my stomach anymore.  Also the service is great and fast. They rapidly provide a small plate of side dish (steamed peanut and pickled daikon) right after we sit down, even though the water tastes really bad! (For me, it's probably the worst water in Arizona) We still enjoy the food and service very much!  Will return when I want some fresh homemade noodle.

I was cranky on a Saturday morning and the only thing to pull me out of the funk was the promise of good Chinese food.  This place has been bookmarked for THREE YEARS and I finally pulled the trigger because - noodles.  We ordered the following: 1. Pan fried dumplings 2. Assorted cold meats 3. Oxtail noodle soup 4. Minced pork noodles  Quick tip - they have several different kinds of noodles here, but we didn't specify which type we wanted to they just defaulted with the skinny ramen-looking kind - such a shame and should be addressed with the order!  Certain dishes would definitely taste better with thicker noodles.   The appetizers were awesome.  Dumplings were huge and meaty and fried to perfection.  The assorted meats were well marinated.  Make sure you dip it in vinegar and chili oil.  YUMMM.  The noodles were unfortunately such a letdown.  They had great texture and I love that they made them in house.  The flavors, however..... ehhhhhhh.... sad.  If you're Chinese or Korean you know that zha jiang mian is one of the ultimate comfort foods.  Every household has a different way of making them but it's usually minced pork with either yellow or black soy bean paste as a base and garnished with cucumbers and sooooometimes cilantro (if you're adventurous).  My family has always added scrambled eggs in the sauce (highly recommended).  I took a bite of the minced pork noodles here and tasted NOTHING.  And for some reason Magic Noodle House garnishes this dish with iceberg lettuce...? Ick!  Why put that on anything?  Oxtail soup wasn't much better.  The broth was okay - but the oxtail was definitely not stewed long enough.  The soup had the teeniest pieces of oxtail and the meat was so rough.  Pass on this.   I usually judge a Chinese restaurant by how it compares to my mother's cooking.  This I couldn't even compare to mine.  Three stars because the service and appetizers were good, and the noodles had great consistency.  I wouldn't be back, though.

We went to China Magic Noodle House for a late lunch.  Met our granddaughter and we all were soooo disappointed in food, service, and attitude of personnel.  We went there because we had read Howard Seftel, ( AZ Republic food critic) article about them on Feb. 19, 2014, and decided to try it.  It was horrible!  The two dishes he had recommended in his article were tried and ugh!  The cream sauce with seafood and corn was tasteless and was the consistently of milk. They brought each of our dishes separately and almost threw them on the table.  Tried the dumplings which were ok but not outstanding.  We did not really feel terrific after meal, AND will never go back or recommend it to anyone.

It's no exaggeration to say that since our first visit here, we have gone every weekend. Their focus on the noodles really sets them apart from other Chinese restaurants. Try one of the flat hand-pulled noodle options; you'll see what I mean. And the portions are generous; each visit to China Magic Noodle House provides us with lunch and dinner for a very reasonable price -- that makes justifying the repeat visits very easy.

I have been coming to China Magic Noodle House for years and definitely my favorite place in Arizona for noodles. It's a fun experience getting to watch them hand pull the noodles and the food is always delicious. Had a problem yesterday calling the restaurant and when I got there I told them and they changed their phones. The Beef Stir Fry Noodles with XO Spicy Sauce is my go to it's amazing with the chili oil. Also the Pan Fried Dumplings and Sesame Balls are really good as well. Definitely a great spot will be back soon!

For February's International Supper Club we went to China Magic Noodle House.  The inside is plan, the main attraction is the opened window were you can see them making the noodles, its sort of mesmerizing  to watch them pull the dough into the noodles we are all going to eat.  Service was fast and friendly.  I ordered fried dumplings and the #34, which was spicy beef stir fry. I wasn't a fan of the dumplings , not any fault of China Magic Noodle; I just don't think Im a fan of dumplings haha..   The #34 was delish! The noodles were soft and perfectly cooked, the dish was spicy and the meat was tender! So good!   Another great meal for the ISCUYE! Thanks China Magic Noodle!
Fresh and yummy.  I nice change from Pho
Kind of hard to understand the cashier but the food came out quick and was delicious.  No issues other than that.

Really like this place. Serves fresh noodles and quality made dumplings that taste home-made. The two dishes I normally order are the noodle with minced pork and beef noodle with spicy XO sauce. Both are delicious have different taste. This is definitely my go to spot when I'm craving Chinese noodles. Reasonably priced as well.

HAND PULLED NOODLES...  I have had these before in Hong Kong and Cali.  Never expected in AZ.  These are as fresh as you can get your noodles!!!  Got the #18 - Beef with Oyster Sauce and I picked the standard ramen noodles.  The noodles were good and the flavor of the beef and oyster sauce was outstanding!!  The steamed dumplings were so so good.  YUM YUM!!!  Also ordered the milk tea with boboa (it was ok).    The service was ok too.  We were waiting for 2 more people to join us, they never came to take our drink order.  They waited for everyone to get there and then took our drinks & food order.

Their chicken chow Mein is delicious!! You can customize with different noodle types. The service is fantastic and very quick! I love their smoothies as well with boba! I definitely will come here on a regular basis. It's a bit hidden but on the northeast corner of Dobson and Warner!

Last night I came out of a 3 hr meeting starving and did a nearby search for restaurants- China Magic Noodle House came up with 23 mins before closing!  As I was 5 mins away, I quickly got into my car and dashed over there!!!! When I got there, there were 2 other people in the restaurant and the waiter, understandably was telling them they could only order take out as it was so close to closing time.  Of course, I was crest fallen. I mean, I was STARVING!!!  It was a busy day- the last time I had something in my stomach was before noon- and now, I have to have take out and eat the noodles in a darkened parking lot inside my car?!?! What's a girl to do in a situation like this?  I pulled out my best sad puppy eyes and my best Chinese!!!!  And I asked them if I could PLEASE eat the noodle soup inside the restaurant. I think it was the Chinese that did the trick as they were surprised this banana spoke Chinese!!!! Ha!  You can bet this bowl of noodle soup was the best tasting one I had ever had!!!!! Oh so tasty and satisfying for my growling empty stomach!!!!! Yes, be impressed as I ate furiously away at my noodle soup while 3 people watched me, waiting to close. And I finished my bowl of lamb noodle soup, noodle style D in slurping 15 mins so I was belly full satisfied by 9:30pm closing time.  That's right, fastest noodle eating ever!!!! Thanks wait staff at China Magic Noodle House for having a little compassion for this (was) starving little 'ole me to let me eat in the restaurant when really, what you wanted after a long day of working was to close up shop and go home!!!!
Love it, staff are friendly and fast. This place is always busy when the family and I come here. Prices are good also.

No complaints. My son and I had our favorite, Sliced Beef Noodle soup. My wife had Braised Beef noodle soup. The noodles are always fresh and the flavor of the soup is excellent. We also had fried dumplings, too good.

I have never had hand pulled noodles before so i ordered it in both the beef stew soup i ordered which was okay. Also in the fried chicken noodles i had ordered. The noodles were tasty but i suggest cutting them a bit so its a little easier to eat.  What i happened to love the most out of our full order was the fried pot stickers and the sauce that came with it was amazing!! i cant wait to go back to order more of the pot stickers and try their boba smoothies and milk tea because i love GOOD boba spots worth going too.   upon arriving i could tell they seemed irritated i had come last minute. i personally am not a fan of staying later than what avg store hours are because i know how it feels.  But only thing was that it was probably half an hour before closing time! i understand you want to go home, everyone does! but to make me feel rushed is not a benefit to your establishment IMO.  I will give it another go one of these days but not just yet.

The noodles are bomb because they are made fresh and the portions are big so it's good to order a few things and share everything. The food came out very fast and the prices are great. I will be back for sure

Watch the noodle man make your noodles from a large plexiglass viewing area. Talk about delicious noodles with texture, chewiness, and your choice of six different cuts ranging from thick to thin to chunks.  Without the help of Yelp our party of 11 would never have entered this place.  Slightly intimidating because it is so authentic, one of my friends actually told the server he was lost about the menu and if she could  help him order.   We ordered noodles, pot stickers, veggies galore, rice, etc. All of it was loved by the group with us all sampling everyone else's dish.  The surprise of the night was the Corn Noodle Shrimp dish which turned out to be the big hit.  Hints of curry combined with the fresh noodles was a flavor dream.   Service was friendly and accommodating.

We wanted noodles and thought to ourselves, why not magic ones? All joking aside, the noodles are fresh - as in made right in front of you, and delicious. The service isn't amazing, but that's not why you go to a place called China magic noodle. Don't expect refill offers or suggestions for appetizers. The menu has pictures, which is useful for some. For a delicious authentic experience, stop here.

The food was great but to be honest the service was horrible. We went on a Wednesday night, arrived a little before 9 PM knowing the place closed at 9:30. We thought that was enough time to order and eat because the service is usually really quick. From the start the waitress was rude and trying to rush us to order, and we had literally just sat down. The people in the window were just staring at us, waiting for us to order. The food was prepared really fast but the employees were just staring at us the WHOLE TIME looking annoyed. The waitress handed us the bill while we were still eating. It was so uncomfortable. I've never been treated that way. We didn't feel welcomed at all. We even left before 9:30. Just a warning if you go, go early. :(

fantastic!!! i have been searching for a good noodle place since my move & love it!!! steamed dumplings to start were delicious and arrived within 5 minutes of ordering. ordered the seafood soup with noodles and was thrilled with it. the brooth was hot and tasty and the noodles were fantastic!!! will def be a repeat customer.

The hype is real. I was blown away. These noodles are no joke. The beef,  the sauce ..all just sooooo good. We got there at 11m on a fri, right when they open. By noon, place was absolutely packed. You choose the kinda noodles you want. There is a window where you can see the chef back there flinging around this wad of dough, making the noodles by hand. 5 stars.  To the owner.. one small thing... Tell the teenager working the register up front to turn OFF his horrible music. I don't wanna hear the annoying vocal stylings of eminem when dining at a wonderful, highly-rated Chinese noodle restaurant.

Probably the best hand pulled noodles you can get in town!  I usually order the XO Sauce Beef Noodle Stir Fry (Shaved Noodles always shaved noodles!). Their pan fried dumplings and salt and pepper fish dish is also awesome.  They do have a viewing window where you can see the incredible skilled chef pulling the noodles apart.  Lastly, I normally finish the meal with a Boba milk tea (delicious).  All in all, you're not going to be disappointed with this place!

(+)s: Hidden in a random plaza, staff that only speaks Chinese, a view into the kitchen where you can watch the hand pulled noodles being prepared. Great prices for authentic chinese food.   I've only been here once but the spicy noodles here are scrumptious.  If I come back the next time and the food is still consistently delicious, this will definitely become a 5 star review

This place really is a "hole in the wall" location.  In fact, if you blink, you might miss it!  But you have to check it out and keep looking until you find it.    All the noodles are handmade fresh, and they are delicious!  Cooked just right, and you can even watch as they are being made.  They let you choose the type of noodle you want with your dish.  My favorite so far are the thick noodles.  Similar to udon noodles.  Their steamed dumplings are HUGE (and also handmade) and are probably the best I've ever had.  The staff is very friendly.  No complaints at all about this place.    My most recent time, I got the spicy beef stir fry.  The beef was tender and seasoned perfectly.  And of course, the noodles were excellent.   My one suggestion is that if you are with a big group, do carry out instead.  It's a very small location and you might be in for a long wait if you're with a large group.  Just make sure you try it!  You won't be sorry.
Finally a decent Chinese place for a good price. Ordered a xo beef fried noodles, pretty good with good portions for like $8.25. The waitress could use better customer service though

If I could leave this place ZERO stars I would. Online and on their door it says open till 9:30, so when we arrived at 8:45 they were already doing side work which is fine but the gal sweeping said "you take out"...REALLY? Poor customer service,  we chose to go elsewhere and probably wouldn't give this place another try.
This place is amazing! Generous portions and a great price! Service is okay, not the best but I def keep coming back because of the food!

Recommended by a friend so we went for lunch. Loved the homemade noodles. I gave it 4 stars because the noodles were like a ball. There weren't any ends to them. When you pick up the noodles they just kept going. While it was impressive with the homemade noodles it was a little difficult to eat. You either have to cut it before you take a bite or you have to bite it off while eating it or just keep slurping.  One thing for sure..we will return and try other dishes!

I came here based on the positive reviews. How is this place still operating?  I ordered the Beef Noodles w/Oyster Sauce. It tasted like something a college freshman put together in his dorm room. I was shocked that they were serving something like this in a restaurant.  The sauce was a thick gravy that was not characteristic of any type of cuisine I have ever tasted. It was sweet and very SALTY; it kind of tasted like a blend of soy sauce, mushrooms, and milk. Once again, I can't put my finger to it, but it was gross. The beef was extremely starchy and rubbery. I tried to cover the taste up with hot sauce, but that didn't work.  One of the ladies (probably the owner or a manager) was nice enough to replace it with their Beef Noodle Soup. This was not disgusting like the first dish, but did not taste good either. The broth was bland and tasted like boiled water with cilantro and a splash of soy sauce.  I left very unsatisfied. I hope readers will take my review seriously and not waste money there.

I really love this place! I try to make it every time I travel to Chandler for supplies at LeeLee's. I've had several soups--oxtail, lamb, sliced beef, braised beef--with varying thickness of noodles. All are in flavorful broth with perfectly cooked noodles. Looking forward to trying more dishes--wish i didn't live an hour away.

I like this place. Each time I eat here I'm thankful Ryan K recommended CMNH to me years back. Ryan, hope you're doin' well on your unfolding Colorado adventure. Let's catch up soon ya big loser!  ANYWAY!  First, don't be scared away. Yeah, at first glance, it's a bit authentic for most Arizonan's comfort zone. Chin up, Imma get ya through. And it will be worth it for ya. We're talkin' lookin-back-years-later-in-fond-remembrance-of-a-life-changing-growth-experience type worth it.  5 Steps to Success. Do this:  1. Grab a seat. Under most circumstances you will be shown your seat with grace and a smile. Understand though, that CMNH isn't the type of place to fawn all over you with appreciation that you have arrived. If the seating is brusque just roll with it. It you find yourself having trouble "rolling with it", try "getting over yourself". One of those approaches should work for ya. Just remember, they aren't trying to offend you.   2. Order some Eggrolls. They're in the OK range of the eggroll quality spectrum. Just do it so you know for next time.  3. Order some Pan-fried dumplings. You could go Steamed, but I prefer, and recommend, the Pan-fried. They are made with Pork, Napa Cabbage, Happiness, and a smidgen of Blocks-Out-The-Freakin'-Sun. Seriously, these things are huge... and damn tasty. Dayum!  4. Order #34, Beef with Stir-Fried Noodles in XO Spicy Sauce. It's not very spicy, relax. You'll need to give them a noodle type. I like the "C" Regular. Hard to go wrong with this choice, just go where ya want on this one. All the noodles are fantastic, hand-stretched on-premises, and undeniably chock-full-a-magic.  5. If feeling adventurous, pick something else off menu. Whatcha got to lose?  That's it. Give it a shot. No need to be intimidated.   Sometimes you just have to jump in. The water's just fine.  Branch out of your next visit. Yeah, I said your NEXT VISIT. That's how confident I am you'll be back.  CMNH tends to be my Pre-Lee-Lee's Supermarket go to. It keeps me from buying up the whole store when I go to Lee Lee's. ;)  Enjoy the Magic.
The food was delicious.  They need to clean up the facility, and definitely clean the window where you watch them make the hand made noodles.
Magic noodles.  What else do I need to say.

We ordered those HUGE dumplings. They were good and tasty. I think that they would be much better if they were smaller, though.  We also ordered garlic green beans as appetizers. HUGE plate of food comes out.  We were going to order a couple of items, but the waitress said "You can share one." And she was right. We ordered beef noodles and it was quite tasty.  The noodles are hand pulled and there is a window into the kitchen where you can watch. When he is not pulling noodles, he is watching the customer crowd. He seems to really enjoy that as he has a smile on his face.  The service was outstanding. Our appetizers and entree came out zippity fast! I noticed that for all the other customers that came after us that their orders came out super fast, too.  When you order, you pick what size of noodle you want in your dish. There is a picture in the menu with brief descriptions. I can't remember them all, but there were five selections from regular to thin to flat, to thick, etc. I wish the pictures were better so you could really tell better.  The prices are outrageously cheap for the quality and quantity that you get. My only beef was with the beef as it was a cheaper cut of beef. But I guess that just adds to the authenticity? :)

I was in the mood for noodles or something and happened upon this Chinese place tucked around the corner  of a strip mall/grocery plaza.  Not opened Mondays so that is a good thing to note.  I wasn't overly fond of the beef and lemon...but the dumplings were amazing...huge...a meal in itself.  The egg rolls were good but a little crispy for my taste.  Prices weren't terrible..I spent 20 bucks on 2 apps, 1 enter and a soda( can so no refills). I would go here again just try something else...another note...freshly pulled noodles and you can view them through the picture window facing the inside of the kitchen.

China Magic Noodle House is truly magical. It is the best Chinese food I have EVER tasted, hands down.  Every single time we order the same thing when we are here (because it's SO INCREDIBLE) and we go out of our way to visit this restaurant. Definitely order the Beef With Stir-Fried Noodles In Xo Spicy Sauce & Steamed Dumplings.  The portions are generous and you can't go wrong with anything truly! I also love their boba teas.

I have to agree with the other reviewers. If you are looking for an authentic Hong Kong style noodle house, this is the best in the East Valley. Prices are very good, restaurant is very clean, portions are huge, and food is extremely tasty. Clear windows to watch the "magic" of noodle making, and the kids had a blast watching. They were even given a dough ball by the very nice chef to try their hand at it. Overall, quite impressed!  I would suggest the "Hand-pulled" noodles over the other variety.

Wow so yummy! Family style so don't over order. We took a lot home, but it was worth it. Fair pricing, excellent food and some entertainment ie you get to watch the noodles being made. This is a great casual dining experience.

Who doesn't like noodles?    While you can get noodle-based dishes almost anywhere, China Magic Noodle is special.  Theirs are hand-pulled to order, by someone I can only describe as a Magic Noodle Man.  From the window between the dining room and kitchen you can watch the stretching spinning process as they are created, just for you!  While I love the noodles (and I have tried four of the five varieties offered), the real attraction for me are the steamed dumplings.  They also have a pan-fried version, but I like the steamed ones better.  They are amazing - beautiful, huge, pork-filled packets of goodness.  I have at times skipped the other dishes entirely and just had dumplings - they are that good.  What would happen if that Magic Noodle Man decided to go on vacation?  Or realized that hand-pulling noodles was no longer his career calling?  I can tell you that for me, the world would be a little less Magic.
So yummy!! The noodles are amazingly fresh. I had the #34 I've tried other things on the menu but keep going back to the spicy stir fried noodles with beef! Their homemade spicy XO sauce is delish!

It has been a few years since my first review of this place, and I still love it just as much as ever. It's really kid-friendly and my kids love watching their noodles being made. The staff is really helpful and brought out chairs for the kids to stand on so they could see the kitchen better.  I'm sick and all I want are is the sliced beef with soup noodles. I skip eating all other foods when I'm sick and just drink that amazing broth. It's almost magical.  Really, the worst part about this place is trying something new when all my favorites are so awesome. The pork dumplings, the pan fried noodles, and the beef soup are just heavenly. Sigh, one day I'll take another reviewer's advice and try the salt and pepper fish ("the best thing on the menu," according to her,) but it'll be hard.

We went for a weekday lunch and the place was packed. We had to wait 10 min to get a table.  The place is pretty organized and neat. Service was average since there was quite a lot of people.  This place makes fresh noodles from scratch. One can see the chef making the noodles through the glass. I went ahead and ordered lamb noodles. This dish gave me food coma. It was delicious beyond description. Lamb was cooked so good and the broth was light and nice. I chose regular noodles and it was alright for me. They have 4 kinds of noodles and I probably should have chose any other. I would love to try other dishes here.   The price is very affordable and I would highly recommend this place

This was just ok I thought. The noodles were fresh and you could pick so many different kinds but it was pretty salty. We had the stir fry noodles with XO sauce and sliced beef noodle soup. The noodle soup tasted more like a pho broth.

Eh, not sure what all the hype is about the noodles here. For homemade noodles this place kinda sucks. I think they have A LOT of room for improvement in that department.  It was cool to watch the guy make the noodles, I had huge expectations but completely let down.  I wanted a soup so I ordered the oxtail soup (tasted like pho broth) with wide noodles. I should have been able to slurp the hell out of those noodles but I couldn't do squat! The noodles were extra chewy and soooooo long. I mean, I get it the noodles are made in house, but sheeeeesh this ain't lady and the tramp.  You can barely cut them with ur teeth, I promise u, this place is over rated for the noodles.  Oxtails------ total fail. This was super small slivers of oxtail. Don't expect much meat at all   The only thing that was super delish was the spicy pig ears. Yes, pig ears cuz I'm nasty like that!!!  It's sliced thinly and hot pan fried with chili oil and pretty darn good. It was so good we got another order to go for later.  Only thing is they pile it on top of some pickled veggies so it seems like you're getting a lot, but you're really not   Bottom line, if you're in the neighborhood and nothing else seems yummy, I guess try this place so u can say u had it.   Noodles 2 stars Pig ears 4 stars

1st time there and we were NOT disappointed.  Spicy stir fried beef with those fresh homemade noodles was quite tasty and the place reminded me of being in Asia.  Very reasonable priced and right next to Lee Lees World Market!
4the time went there. I like fried noodle and noodle soup, my husband really like the starter peanuts and veggie, our friend likes here too:) staff there are really nice and friendly

This is my new favorite Chinese restaurant in the Valley! The atmosphere is casual and unpretentious, the service attentive, and the food phenomenal and homey. Lots of parking spots in the strip mall too!  I've tried 4 types of noodles-- and they were all delicious. The thick noodles were my favorite, kind of like an udon noodle in thickness. The wide flat noodles were also superb, though a little hard to eat times because it was so long and wide. My s/o found the regular noodles yummy, but a little too long to handle (though I had no trouble with it). Because of this, I suggested he try the shaved noodles. He much preferred these because they were shorter noodles, but I found their texture a little off.   Noodles with minced pork sauce have been one of my favorite dishes since childhood, and though the ones at CMNH didn't blow my mind, they were solid and the best I've had in the US. The beef with fried noodles in XO Spicy Sauce didn't have a strong XO flavor, but was great, with lots of veggies.

The cool thing about this place is that they hand pull your noodles to order. They have 5 different varieties of noodles, and you can watch them pulling your noodles, if you are in to that kind of thing. I am.   We stopped in for dinner around 8, and it wasn't too crowded.  We started with the Pig Ear and eggrolls as appies.  The eggrolls were pretty typical for a chinese restaurant, kinda blah.   I couldn't eat the pig ears, because, uh, I just wasn't in the mood for pig ears. Yeah, that's it.  Of course, the platter came to the table with a HEAPING serving of pig ears. We ordered a small, so I can't imagine what the large size looked like.   I had the spicy noodle with beef in XO sauce, and my guy had the spicy noodles (vegetarian).  The noodles had the perfect chew, and the sauce was really good. I would recommend the XO sauce, the spicy sauce was good, but the XO was just better.   I would prolly hit this place up if I was still in Arizona.  It was one of the better meals I had while I was there.

It's one of best Chinese restaurant in the valley! Very authentic, good atmosphere, very kind staffs, tasty food, reasonable prices and great portion! They also make hand made noodle there. Very fresh!!  We had no.16 and 22 noodle and pan fried dumpling. It was great portion. Food was great! Very impressive! Especially 22 noodle! It's awesome! Very flavorful dish :)  I'm very glad to find the restaurant today :) I must go back next time and try other noodles! Can't wait to go back here :)

The Best Noodles I have had in the Valley!  They make traditional noodles in house and they have a window to watch how. If you have not seen real noodles made stop by this place not only do you get to see how but the food is very good as well.   Of course the noodles are Awesome but the dumplings are as well one of these says I will try something else but I am stuck on the these two items right now :)
The homemade noodles here are awesome.  You can definitely tell the difference between homemade noodles and the other stuff.

About time I found legit ??????.  The interior feels like a cheap Chinese restaurant with poor countryside chinamen that man the booth.  The broth tastes good and tastes more or less what I expect it to taste like.  The hand pulled noodles are chewy (This is how noodles should taste) and matches the noodle soup perfectly without making it ever being soft and soggy.  The Pig Ears were also plentiful and packed into a nice small hill.  The price is a bit more than what I am used to, but it's a great restaurant and I will return again.

Steamed dumplings were large, homemade but refrigerator cold inside.  Not pork filled like typically found.  Brown discoloration.  Noodles with crab and shrimp - homemade noodles all stuck together.  My guess is covered with store bought Alfredo sauce.  I will not return.
This is definitely one of the best Chinese restaurants in the Phoenix metro area! The Beef with Spicy XO Sauce and wide flat noodles are amazing.  The dumplings are great too and are HUGE.

I'll have to try one more time this place. On a weird week where I was having cravings for noodles this came perfect! noodles are made in your face!! Very affordable and tasty.   PLUS it is in my favorite asian corner, where Lee Lee's  is, Dim sum, boba tea, dairy queen.... heheh.

So good! I heard about this place from a recommendation of a friend on FB. I'm glad I came here the noodles were extremely fresh and good. One thing I would change is to cut the noodles up more so it's not so long (it was hard for little ones to eat them). We dined inside and the customer Service was great, fairly fast and efficient.
This was the best noodle house I had been to.  The noodles were freshly pulled and the broth was very tasty.  Wish they had such a noodle shop in Sacramento.

I really loved this restaurant.   I love fresh noodles and I ran over after seeing they make them to order.  They do this in some areas of China and the beef noodle soup tasted just like I had when I was in Bejing for the first time 15 years ago.  I recommend bringing your children in to see this man make noodles and have a nice, casual, well made, delicious,  inexpensive bite!

Super authentic Chinese noodles. I've spent a lot of time in China and had many bowls of ?? which roughly translates to Ramen, and this is the best I've had in Phoenix. it's also the only place I know of to get ??? or shaved noodles. A must eat!  The atmosphere is what I would call classic Chinese restaurant, something very similar to what you would see in China. Nothing fancy, but certainly adequate. Service is also great. Don't miss out on the Boba drinks.

i love the xo sauce in my shaved beef soup with the shave nooodles , yummm the service is always excellent , the restaruant decor is right on point for a no frills noodle shop, it's all business and the business is great. staff is always smiling and friendly ..

Six of us had lunch today at the China Magic Noodle House, and all of us enjoyed it.  We sampled the beef dumplings appetizer (virtually "pot sitckers") while awaiting our order.  My brother-in-law and I had the #19 Shrimp & Crab* over hand-made noodles in a creamy white sauce (like Alfredo sauce) which was very good.  My wife had the #19 Oyster Beef and was quite pleased with it.  The portions were large, and all of us took boxes of left-overs home.  This is a great place for lunch in Chandler, Arizona, and in the same shopping center as the LeeLee market (Asian foods). *imitation crab

Best I have ever had. Leftovers still good when heated up... Very good, so much I got a takeout menu and at the rest of my food later in the day. I am soooo going back. I have yet to find any place that is this good and easy on the wallet.

tldr; extremely rude service, slightly below average food   Had the worst experience here last night. We arrived at 9:05pm. Well aware of their closing time, and not wanting to be assholes, we decided to order Togo. The waiter came over, and asked us if we were ready after less than 30 seconds with the menu. When I asked him to please give us just another minute, he made a face, harrumphed, and said "come on guys we are closing". Fair enough, but I'm not ready to order. Please give me just another minute. Even more impatient now, he repeated "no we are closing come on guys hurry up." I am a server myself, and I know the dismay of having a table walk in late. But the first rule of being a server is having common courtesy. After all, you are working for tips. After his rudeness we promptly left, at which the other waiter yelled thank you to us, thinking we were a happy, satisfied table who was leaving after their meal, as there were still SEVERAL other tables inside eating. Sorry to say that wasn't the case. Will never come here again.   Side note, I have been here twice before. Each time the service has always been typical small restaurant asian service. You sit, they bring you water, take your order, and bring you your bill. Nothing extraordinary and certainly nothing like where they are checking on you to make sure everything is okay. Being Chinese who grew up in the industry, this is the type of service I actually prefer when I go out to eat, simply because I don't want all the fuss. This last experience was on a whole new low. Aside from that, the food is alright. Nothing extraordinary. The broth tastes like msg and the noodles, both times, were underdone and slightly doughy. In China, there is one of these noodle stands on every single corner and they all blow this place out of the water. I kept wanting to see what these great reviews were about to see if they stood up to the challenge, but I guess I'm just the unlucky one.
Owner messaged me with two more vegetarian dishes: vegetarian spring roll and yau choi(Chinese vegs)with oyster sauce or you can do it stir fried with garlic.

First Impression: Strong stench when walked in that made me  almost turn around & leave. Not sure if it's kimchee, pickled veggies?  Typical hole in the wall non-chain Asian eatery Translation: expect mediocure service, passable                        very basic plain decor                         Open kitchen looked messy, things everywhere                       chefs just chilling in dining rm til order in   (ladies bathroom was strangely ornate compared to rest of place, like someone had leftover tiles and decided to use it)  Now the yummy Food: After all, we certainly didnt go for it's ambiance Came out very quickly. Sesame paste noodles was delicious  Reminds me of ones I had in China my mouth waters just thinking about it may have to pinch my nose and make a run mrw.. hehe Beef Stew Soup Noodles was ok.  Happy to see a noodle house addition to Phoenix.

Whoooo-Hoooooo Hand drawn noodles are da bomb and this place didn't disappoint.   Chinese Dumplings were some of the best I've ever had (including Mainland China). The filling was perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of ginger and garlic.   The soup with noodles was to die for, it's not PHO people (other yelpers have confused it) it's Chinese soup and they pulled off the broth perfectly. The Stir-fried noodles had a wee bit too much Sesame oil IMHO but they were still very yummy.  Service was spot on and friendly. Watermelon and Mango smoothies were super delicious.   Price - GREAT value, wish we had this place where I lived.

This is the real deal. The noodles are prepared to order. The regular noodles with beef and XO sauce excellent. The savory flavor of the wok chard goodness came through this dish and delighted my palate as well as my olfactories. Everything here is well prepared. Fried dumplings are excellent as well as filing. Looking for the real authentic noodle house experience? This is it my friend.

I was the first time I went to try the dumplings because you would already be getting the homemade noodles. This is why magic noodle stands out over other Chinese planes they hand pull the noodles there are 5 to chose from. You can have them stir fried or in soup. They have different appetizers like cold meat plate

I had wanted to visit this spot for a long time so one weekend I took the trip... I entered to a pretty busy spot I was seated right away. I was handed a menu and water and a plate of peanuts and pickled stuff... I was passed over for a bit and I called someone over to order... I went with the No. 34 Beef with Noodles in XO Spice Sauce and an order of egg rolls. I rate the food as followed.  Beef with Fried Noodles in XO Spicy Sauce - B Egg Rolls - C + Staff - D   I want to give this spot another try... I was kind of disappointed on this trip but there are many other things I want to try off the menu let's hope the next trip is on point.

Went there the other night my boyfriend had #34 and ate the whole plate with shaved noodles.  I got the seafood noodle bowl soup and it was so delicious.  We had a side of pan fried dumplings and there were so yummy!  We are for sure going back there again.  The staff was super friendly :) Cash only for a reason and worth it!
the best place for noodles and fried dumplings!!!!!!!!!!!!!! the tap water is nasty so i recommended getting a drink, not the boba tea.

SO Good!  Homemade AND absolutely yummy.  Affordable, generous portions. Deserts are also out of this world. Can't go wrong between this and other restaurants in this shopping center.  Best to go on weekdays to avoid crowds.  I'll be frequenting this place often!  I'm from Boston and thought this tops many of the restaurants, there. That's quite a compliment.

Full of flavor. Huge portions! Great prices. Fast service. I was so happy to find a place here in Arizona that serves noodles made to order. You can't go wrong with what you pick. I've tried the potstickers, soups, seafood with noodles. So many times I can't decide so I take a friend and we split our soup and noodles.

Believe the hype. Best noodles I've ever had. Wish I could wear them around my neck. Ordered steamed dumplings and #34 with wide noodles. The only reason I'm waking up tmr is to eat the rest for breakfast.

Worst customer service ever. We kindly asked for lemons since their tap water tasted contaminated and the server replies, "I only have 2 hands." When the food finally came, the 2nd server slammed the food on the table with liquid from the soup splashing all over us and server made no apologies.   We asked the server what kind of sauce was included with the fried tofu with we had ordered and waiters response was "tofu sauce". That's when we asked him why he was being so rude and he literally began to use vulgar language towards us in front of multiple families with small children. Will never return here and be sure to complain to the BBB in regards to this incident. We will NEVER come back here.   Please consider any and every other restaurant before even considering this classless restaurant. With such horrible level of service I really don't understand how they are open.
the pot stickers were da bomb!!!  most def revisit joint!  "Piece"!!!

Super yummy noodles! But the seasoning and sauces lacked depth and were a tad heavy.  I got the Shrimp and Corn Curry Noodles, the sauce was good but was super super heavy.  Also got the XO Spicy noodles, I liked how they're were an assortment of veggies in them, but the sauce was lacking flavor.  I do like how you get 5 noodle types to choose from!

Noodles are the heart and soul of Asian cuisine and I know that finding a genuinely good and authentic noodle house is an exciting prospect for all of you fans out there just as it is for us. I discovered this place just by surfing online and when I learned that one of my Elite Yelp friends, on whose opinion I rely religiously, had given it a 5-star review I knew we had to try it as soon as possible.  My girlfriend and I were pleasantly greeted with a small plate of pickled daikon and boiled peanuts. We the shared a small order of Spicy Hot Pig Ear appetizer, Noodles with Minced Pork Sauce, and Ox Tail with Soup Noodles. The portion sizes for all the dishes was very generous and more than enough for the two of us.  The texture of the pig ear was delectably tender and satisfying and it was served at a perfect slightly warm temperature with just the right amount of spice. We ended up mixing some of slices of pig ear to both noodle dishes to add an extra dimension of yumminess, We ordered regular pulled noodles with the minced pork and shaved noodles with the ox tail and we thoroughly enjoyed the excellent consistency of both as we watched the chef pulling more noodles in the kitchen The soup broth was yummy with good depth of flavor, the ox tail was tender, and the minced pork was nicely seasoned, and the veggies were properly cooked.  My girlfriend, who is a native of mainland China, vouched for the authenticity of all the dishes. The service was prompt and courteous and the prices were reasonable. This restaurant is now on our list of favorites and we will definitely return.  Photo design by Billie Z.

Great hand pulled noodles are a textured sensation! Watching your noodles being pulled to order is an added extra! Very simple preparations so don't expect a lot of complexity. Just plain good noodles.
Ordered the famous chicken stir fry noodles to go tonight..  I was really disappointed the noodles was bland and the chicken was nasty..
Ok it's a noodle shop!! So unless you're a noodle junkie ,it is just ok!! If you like noodles it's great

A group of us came for dinner and arrived at 6:00. We were seated immediately. The restaurant is, to put it nicely, sparsely decorated, and is quite simple inside. However, don't let the lack of decor fool you. The food more than makes up for it. This is the only Chinese restaurant in the greater Phoenix area that makes real hand pulled noodles. The last time I had noodles of this quality, it was in Hong Kong!   There is a big picture window where you can watch the chef stretching the dough and making any of the 5 kinds of noodles. I started off with the marinated beef tendon. Usually, you get a small plate with a little portion of the tendon on it. Here, I was surprised to get a big plate with a huge portion of tendon on it. To be honest, it was more than I could possibly eat, but we all made a good stab at it.  Next, I ordered a portion of noodles with XO sauce. This is a spicy sauce that really brings out the flavors in foods, and I was not disappointed. It was fun to watch the chef prepare the dish through the window. All my guests were mesmerized watching the preparation. Each person ordered a different dish, and all were pronounced flavorful and excellent.  Service is simple, but quick. Considering the prices, one has to wonder how they can stay in business. Big plates of food at very low prices.  Were it not for the simple decor, this place would easily rate 4 stars.  3 stars for portion size and quality.  A good place to eat your fill at a reasonable price.

We have been coming here for about a year now & really love it here. No, it's not fancy, but the food is great, the service is great and the noodles are to die for! If you are looking for a great carb fix, this is your go to place

My Dearest China Magic Noodle House,   I have lived barely a mile away from you the past three years and have never given you the time of day.  How wrong was I to neglect your heavenly cuisine and ambiance (suspect olfactory assault included) that brings me right back to the Bay!   Dude and I dropped by on a lazy Saturday afternoon.   Based on many of our friends' Yelp reviews, we knew going in that we were going try the XO Spicy Beef Noodles ($8.25) and the Pan Fried Dumplings ($4.95).   Oh, those dumplings. Not your typical Chinese restaurant freezer dumplings; these babies are on 'roids! There's eight to an order and they're practically a meal on their own. We were pleased to find these weren't overcooked or greasy, a common mistake.   My only complaint is I wish there were more vegetables.   As for the noodles, you can pick the width (really thin, really wide,  somewhere in between, insert your dirty jokes here). We went with the standard C noodles.   While they were fresh and delicious, the beef was just OK. I also wish the XO delivered a little more heat as promised, but nothing a little chili oil can't fix. Next time, I'll ask for them extra spicy!   Can we also talk about the portion sizes here? Between a heaping plate of noodles and behemoth dumplings, we were able to take home leftovers that heated up perfectly the next day for lunch.   Prices are similar to what those corporate Asian food establishments charge, but it's obviously so much better.   Sit by the window and you're in for a real show. So much fun to watch all the noodles being hand stretched!   Already plotting another trip to this little slice of home on Dobson and Warner to work my way through that extensive menu.   Yay, I'm a fan indeed!
We jumped in for lunch. Never been here before. Noodles are made on the spot. Chicken Fried Rice, Vegetable and egg soup and Chicken stir fry were all so good. Try it, you'll sure to be back.

09/08 and 09/29  On my first visit here, I ordered egg rolls and a stir-fried beef noodle dish.  It was such fun to watch noodles being made that I couldn't wait to bring Mom over so that she could see it herself.  Service was friendly and helpful, and the place (and restroom) looked very clean.  Really loved the egg rolls!  They're so good, I'm going to have to order them every time I visit.  The noodles were good, but the meat portion of this dish was pretty dismal-- the noodle to meat ration had to have been at least 3 to 1.  No exaggeration!  (I had hoped it was a fluke, but it wasn't-- more detail to come later.)  Once I'd exhausted the beef content (and there wasn't much), I wasn't satisfied enough w/ the noodle flavor to continue.  (If only the noodles were as tasty as those I'd tried at Saigon Bowl the night before...)  There was no doubt, however, that these noodles were freshly made--  I really enjoyed its texture!  Took Mom w/ me on my second visit.  Decided to try the steamed gyoza and a noodle dish w/ ground pork.  Wished I'd ordered the eggrolls, instead :(  The gyoza dish was, without question, the worst WE'D ever tried!  Too heavy on the batter, and steamed was definitely not the way to go.  (Once you have a look at the photos, you'll agree!)  Same thing w/ the pork.  Too crumbly and unexciting flavor (salty and lemony), and again, the meat to noodle ratio was very low.    Two visits, and it's Hit-1, Miss-1.  At least I'll know that the app will be a hit (egg rolls), and if I remember to order a double- or a triple-serving of meat, maybe the noodle portion won't be a miss...

I honestly just love this restaurant. Mainly because the food is just so good. The Pan Fried Dumplings are honestly the best I've ever had. My family loves getting the green beans as a side dish. While I know Hong Kong rolls are listed as an appetizer they are a great dessert. I do find the soup broths a little bland.   I admit I have not liked everything I've ever had here but I was exploring dishes. I am an adventurous eater though so I don't blame the kitchen in those cases.  You need to be aware that you're only coming for the food. It's a small hole in the wall location. There is no fancy decor. Most of the wait staff does not speak English. I find a lot of times the behavior some people find rude stem from a difference in culture. You're not going to get a waiter who is super perky and grovels for you if you're the slightest bit displeased. You will instead get basic service that gets your delicious food to you as quickly as possible.   The noodles are amazing. So amazing. No matter what dish you get. Nothing can beat a fresh noodle. I know some people not used to fresh noodles can sometimes find them a bit oddly textured. It's ok. Don't try to compare them to your dried noodles at home. These are different and wonderful.  Everything is super cheap. The food is hot, quick, and delicious. The noodles are amazing and fun to watch being made. What more do you want?

Went last night (6/13/11).  We also had the Groupon, and were anxious to try the place.  We were NOT disappointed!  My wife had the Fried Noodles with Chicken, and I had the Fried Noodles with Beef in Spicy XO sauce.  Enormous portions, and soooooo tasty.  Noodles were excellent, beef was super tender, and seasoning was just about perfect.  Highly recommended, and we'll be returning soon.

This is one of those places you want to keep secret so they won't get overwelmed and go downhill.   Or raise prices.   Get the dumplings, ever if you don't like dumplings.  You will like these.  Its good .   Soup or stir fry.   Its yummy yummy.   Its not fancy.   The wait people are polite and keep the drinks filled.

There are so many different sauces! And types of noodles! And ways that they are cooked! And, you can be a creep and watch the noodle guy through the window. The noodles are really good, and the soups are pretty good too, although I am still not sure what exactly fish balls are. I recommend the sesame paste noodles if you aren't feeling too risky. If you are feeling risky, go for the fish balls and let me know how that goes.

Don't get me wrong, the noodles were really good and you get to watch through a little window as they make the noodles (which is very cool!), but the place smelled REALLY bad. The odor was hard to describe - between really really really bad rotting fish and something chemical/synthetic. The rest of our food was average (fried tofu, shrimp platter, fish/shrimp noodles, vegetable noodles), but the horrible smell turned our stomachs. We won't be back.

Watch noodles being pulled while you wait! lol  The thick noodles are the best, they are long, mis-shaped, chewy and just plain wonderful. However, the real gems on the menu have nothing to do with noodles! Their you choy (their spelling) and the green beans with garlic are phenomenal. The you choy is served in a delicate light broth, and steaming hot. The green beans are stir-fried whole with large cloves of garlic, worth the long drive to Mesa.   The service is not great, at all, but if you are looking for good customer service and cheery employees, you are shopping in the wrong plaza. Its part of the fun though right?
Fresh handmade noodle. You can select different width of the noodle. El dente.  Service is very fast.  No doubt this is best Chinese noodle house in town.

I live about 1000 miles across town from this place, but was driving my husband to the Mesa Gateway Airport, which I swear was in western New Mexico and needed to take a detour here on the way home. I had heard and read so much about it plus I am a sucker for Asian food and noodles, so not really a choice.  I took some time to learn the menu, full of dozens of options plus LOTS of authentic Asian delicacies, such as pig ears and tendon (neither of which I fear) and after a recommendation from the waiter, settled on the ground pork in sauce (over noodles of course). The food literally hit my table in less than 5 minutes! It was hot and delicious and I got to watch them making noodles while I ate. There were so many combinations I would have like to have tried. Next time I have a few hours to kill, I will grab some friends or family to go with me so I can try more entrees by stealthily eating off their plates. If you are lucky enough to live near by, GO. NOW! And think of me...  PS: In multiple subsequent visits I would have to say you should not miss the XO sauce on either the wide or shaved noodles and the not to be missed dumplings, steamed or fried (though I think I preferred the steamed) are mind boggling in the amount of flavor packed into those puppies and the amount you get for the teeny price is incredible.

I am a real fan of Pho and there are quite a few option in this area. I have seen this place next to LeeLee's for a while but never thought anything of it. The other night I needed something just for myself so i figured I would go in for a to-go order.  It was really quite good. Everything was fresh - especially the noodles - and the meat and broth were great tasting. One of the better places in the area. Looking forward to going back. Service was very friendly and fast  While the place had a funky smell upon entering - don't let that put you off. The food is excellent and watching them make the noodles fresh on the spot is an extra treat.
Freshly made noodles for a good price.  Portions are fairly large for the price as well.  We got 2 noodle dishes to go, and they were pretty satisfied.

I had wanted to try this place for a long time, but was extremely underwhelmed. I got the seafood with stir-fried noodles and my husband got the beef with stir-fried noodles in XO sauce. Mine was so bland and the noodles too chewy. I had to add chile sauce and soy sauce to taste it. His tasted good, but was missing the beef. There was only one other table in the place and three people working in front, but nobody came to check on us until we were through and they all were engaged in their cell phones. One employee was even watching videos, and very well could've been on a break, but I didn't care to hear them. The magic noodles weren't enough to bring me back.

The noodles here are spectacular! I have never been able to deviate from the chicken stir fry with noodles because I love it. You can watch them make the noodles on site, which is a great way to entertain my kids while we wait for our food. On several occasions, I have also purchased noodles to take and stir fry at home. You can get an order of plain noodles for about $3, which I think is fair.
Best noodles ever!! Plus service is fast and friendly. The wavy flat noodles are the way to go. All of them are good but that's my favorite!!

Fresh noodles and the largest Dumplings I've ever had. I had the Beef Rib Noodle soup and my hubby had Spicy Chicken noodle stir fry.  There were too many onions in the stir fry dish. The servers seemed a bit annoyed that we were not ready to order.  Serving size was enough to bring home leftovers. The flavors of our food was ok, but  we won't rush back. Decent place for lunch.

We all have those iconic food moments in our lives and one of mine was in a small noodle shop off the Hibaya subway line in Tokyo where they made noodles by hand, scraping noddles off a huge block of dough, with a pastry scraper, into a large wok of boiling water with huge clouds of steam rising up into the cooking area (they also made one hell of a pan fried Gyoza that I still dream about), and I've spent the last two years thinking how great to have a place like it in Phoenix.   Well, wishes do come true because I was flipping through the 2010 best of Phoenix from New Times earlier this week and China Magic Noodle House was in there as a place to try so today, after watching the early screening of the movie Social Networking, I headed over to Chandler to try it out. I was pleasantly surprised to see it in the same shopping center as Lee Lee's, an Asian market that people have been telling me to check out for ages.  Well, I walk in and a fairly large space with plenty of tables. The menu had several types of noodles and through a glass window in the back you can see cooks making fresh noodles. I chose the scraped noodles with minced pork since that seemed the closest to what I had in Japan. I also noticed that they had a variety of fresh fruit drinks (included a special of watermelon for $2), but stuck with water so I could focus on the noodles. The ones that came out were scraped and somewhat longer than the ones I had in Tokyo and they seemed a bit drier as well, though when I mixed up the bowl there was some great pork broth, along with shredded lettuce. I added some hot chili paste that was provided on the table and a splash or two of soy sauce, did another mix, and well, started eating.  Okay, different from the noodles in Tokyo but...I had one of those great food experiences where you sort of zone out a bit because you enjoy what you are eating so much. Something about the fresh made noodles, the flavorful mix of pork meat and broth, and the slight bite of the chili paste was, as we say in Hawaii, Ono (good)! I don't know if I am willing to say I love the place yet but from a first try, I am definitely a fan. The best part, after the meal you can go cruise around in Lee Lee's for a bit and see specialty food items from just about every Asian culture you can imagine. Next time I go to the noodle shop I'll try the soup noodles - the soup noodles with lamb is on my radar! All I can say, I hope they expand and open a place in Tempe. Their food is inexpensive, fresh, and tasty, perfect for college students.
These are some of the best dumplings I have ever had!! Way more than I expected. I got them to take home along with the beef noodles and I have plenty left over for a couple more meals!

YUP.  Came here for lunch today, and it's official-  this is a Scott P. spot. I crave this shit, even just a few hours after eating it. Granted, this was only my second time here, and that's a big soon for a five-star rating, but I'll be duckfucked if this place doesn't make me smile in a big way.  For starters... they serve BOILED PEANUTS and daikon radish as soon as you sit down. Did you hear me?? I said:  THEY SERVE BOILED PEANUTS!! When's the last time you had some boiled peanuts!??! Have you EVER had boiled peanuts?? I know it's a Southern thing, but it's just one of those unexpected treats in life where you're like:  "HOLY SHITSTEAM! This place serves one of my favourite foods without me even asking for me!!"  Yeah.  So anyways- their noodles = I crave. Especially the 'hand-shaved' noodles (style E). THey just absorb whatever sauce they're in, and their texture is just MM MM MMM goodness.  Yeah. I'll shut up now, but I really have to say that you need to at least try this place. You owe it to yourself to try this place. And bring your mom.
I asked co-workers to treat me to CMNH for my birthday and wasn't disappointed. The dumplings weren't vegetarian friendly, but I sampled one, and it was amazing.  Huge portions at great prices.

Inspired to write this because I saw a photo on yelp that was titled "steamed gyoza-FAIL".  Allow me set the record straight: The dumplings here are straight up amazing. I lived in China for a year and I ate more than my fair share of dumplings...and I will tell you that these are the only ones I've found in the US that we're even close to resembling what I had in china.  No, they aren't the same as the pre packaged skin, tiny, flavorless gray meat filling ones you get at nearly every other restaurant in the states. They are made fresh and legit. The skin is thick and chewy. The meat highly seasoned. And fried to perfection.   If you call Chinese dumplings by a Japanese spelling, that should tell you something. And ordering them steamed is a fail in itself, but that is user error, not a fault of the kitchen.   In short: go here, order the dumplings, get them fried. You can thank me later.
